original: skyes bu yang de lta bu'o zhes pa khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu yang de lta bu'o zhes pa khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: A person is like that.

original: gang rnams sgra'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa dbang po'i 'jug pa la nges par snang ba na yid kyi 'jug pa nye bar skyes pa na /
analyzed: gang rnams sgra'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa dbang po'i 'jug pa la nges par snang ba na yid kyi 'jug pa nye bar skyes pa na /
translated: When the transformation of the aspect of sound is definitely perceived in the engagement of the sense faculty, the engagement of the mind arises.

original: skyes bu yang de'i rnam par 'jug pa nye bar skyes la /
analyzed: skyes bu yang de'i rnam par 'jug pa nye bar skyes la /
translated: A person also arises in that aspect.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam pa yongs su 'gyur ba can skyes bu'o zhes 'dod pa ni /🔽gtan tshigs ma @128a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam pa yongs su 'gyur ba can skyes bu'o zhes 'dod pa ni / gtan tshigs ma @128a * //
translated: Therefore, a person is one whose engagement has a transformation of aspect.

original: grub pa nyid du smra par byed do //
analyzed: grub pa nyid du smra par byed do //
translated: They say that the reason is unestablished.

original: de rnams kyi skyes bu ni gtso bo'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi skyes bu ni gtso bo'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: Their person is the nature of the primal substance.

original: de ltar ni yid kyi 'jug pa ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ni yid kyi 'jug pa ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: The engagement of the mind is of the nature of the three qualities.

original: skyes bu'i 'jug pa yang de'i rnam ba can te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'jug pa yang de'i rnam ba can te /
translated: The engagement of the person is of that aspect.

original: de las kyang de yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de las kyang de yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro /
translated: Moreover, that would have the nature of the three qualities.

original: de lta na yang 'jug pa dang 'jug ldan gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na skyes bu yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid 'thob cing /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jug pa dang 'jug ldan gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na skyes bu yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid 'thob cing /
translated: Even so, since the engaged and the one possessing engagement are not different, the person also obtains the nature of the three qualities.

original: yon tan gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir yang de yang gtso bo kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir yang de yang gtso bo kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it has the nature of the qualities, it too would be the principal alone.

original: de la yang bshad pa'i skyon te /
analyzed: de la yang bshad pa'i skyon te /
translated: And there is the fault already explained with respect to that.

original: gtso bo yang gcig nyid du khas blangs pa nyams so zhes pas 'di ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo yang gcig nyid du khas blangs pa nyams so zhes pas 'di ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: And the assertion that the principal is one alone is undermined. Therefore this is pointless.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: With respect to “inference, etc.,” etc.,

original: sogs pa'i sgras sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: the term “etc.” includes verbal testimony, analogy, and presumption.

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because they are preceded by perception.

original: de dang 'dra ba kho na zhes pa /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba kho na zhes pa /
translated: “Like it” means

original: ji ltar mngon sum chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa de ltar rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa de ltar rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ste /
translated: Just as perception is not a reason in regard to the nature of things, so also are inference, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are preceded by perception.

original: de kho na'i phyir 'di rnams mdor byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i phyir 'di rnams mdor byas pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they are not included in the summary.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnams ci'i don du yongs su brtags par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnams ci'i don du yongs su brtags par bya ba yin na /
translated: For what purpose are the authorities, perception, etc., to be examined?

original: rtsod pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos yin la mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos yin la mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du ste /
translated: In order to understand that the nature of a dispute is a property, and that the nature of perception, etc., is not.

original: mngon sum yang chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid du shes pa na /
analyzed: mngon sum yang chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid du shes pa na /
translated: When it is understood that perception is not a reason in regard to the nature of things,

original: mngon sum sngon ma can gang yin pa gzhan de yang chos yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro zhes shes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon ma can gang yin pa gzhan de yang chos yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro zhes shes pa kho na ste /
translated: then it is understood that the others, which are preceded by perception, are also not reasons for understanding a property.

original: de mdor byas pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de mdor byas pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of including them in the summary?

original: 'o na ci ltar dpyod pa la tshad ma drug rnams rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar dpyod pa la tshad ma drug rnams rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Well then, how are the six valid cognitions to be understood in the analysis?

original: 'grel pa byed pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The author of the commentary says:🔽There, the author of the commentary says there and so on.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pas sun 'byin pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pas sun 'byin pa gsungs so //
translated: He says there and so on to refute that.

original: 'o na mdor mngon sum sngon ma can nyid mdor ma byas pa nyid la gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar blangs shing /
analyzed: 'o na mdor mngon sum sngon ma can nyid mdor ma byas pa nyid la gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar blangs shing /
translated: Well then, in the sutra, the fact that it has a prior direct perception is taken as the reason itself, without being summarized.

original: 'grel pa ni tshad ma nyid yongs su shes pa la ste /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni tshad ma nyid yongs su shes pa la ste /
translated: The commentary is for the complete understanding of valid cognition.

original: gal te gang mngon sum snga ma can de tshad ma nyid du rnam par shes par 'gyur na zhes mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gang mngon sum snga ma can de tshad ma nyid du rnam par shes par 'gyur na zhes mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to be known as valid cognition, then it would be expressed as that which has a prior direct perception.

original: des na ci ltar 'grel pa mdo'i don gyi rjes su @128b 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'grel pa mdo'i don gyi rjes su @128b 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: So how does the commentary follow the meaning of the sutra?

original: mdor mngon sum sngon ma can nyid mdor ma byas pa'i brgyud pas gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar blangs kyi /
analyzed: mdor mngon sum sngon ma can nyid mdor ma byas pa'i brgyud pas gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar blangs kyi /
translated: In the sutra, the fact that it has a prior direct perception is taken as the reason itself through a series of summaries,

original: dngos su ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos su ma yin la /
translated: but not directly.

original: brgyud pa de kho na bstan pa'i ched du gang mngon sum sngon ma can zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par bshad pa byas so zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: brgyud pa de kho na bstan pa'i ched du gang mngon sum sngon ma can zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par bshad pa byas so zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: In order to show that very lineage, he explains “because it has a prior direct perception,” and so on.

original: gal te yang tshad mar yongs su shes pa kho na mdor ma byas pa'i gtan tshigs bar ma chad par brjod par bya na /
analyzed: gal te yang tshad mar yongs su shes pa kho na mdor ma byas pa'i gtan tshigs bar ma chad par brjod par bya na /
translated: If, moreover, one were to state the reason without fully understanding the valid cognition,

original: tshad mar yongs su shes pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad mar yongs su shes pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be stated as the reason for fully understanding the valid cognition.

original: de las kyang /
analyzed: de las kyang /
translated: And from that,

original: dran dang 'dod dang sdang pa dang // rtsol sogs tshad mar thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dran dang 'dod dang sdang pa dang // rtsol sogs tshad mar thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it would follow that memory, desire, aversion, effort, and so on would be valid cognition.

original: zhes pa sun 'byin pa 'di 'jug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa sun 'byin pa 'di 'jug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: This refutation would not apply.

original: de'i phyir sun 'byin pa'i skabs sbyin pa'i ched du mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sun 'byin pa'i skabs sbyin pa'i ched du mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, in order to give an opportunity for refutation, he explains, “because it has a prior direct perception.”

original: 'o na dpyod pa la mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyis tshad ma nyid du brjod pa ma yin pa kho na'i /
analyzed: 'o na dpyod pa la mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyis tshad ma nyid du brjod pa ma yin pa kho na'i /
translated: Well then, since analysis has a prior direct perception, it is not stated to be valid cognition at all.

original: 'on kyang 'di rnams chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di rnams chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid brjod de /
translated: But these are not reasons from the point of view of the Dharma.

original: gang smras pa /
analyzed: gang smras pa /
translated: It was said:

original: mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir yang rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba rnams kyang rgyu ma yin pa nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir yang rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba rnams kyang rgyu ma yin pa nyid do zhes so //
translated: Because of having a prior perception, inference, analogy, and inference are not causes.

original: nye ba'i war sha yis kyang rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pas mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnams rab tu grub pa rnams so zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i war sha yis kyang rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pas mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnams rab tu grub pa rnams so zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: And because of being well known, the others are not mentioned. Thus, perception and so on are well established as valid cognitions.

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: 'dir de rnams rab tu grub pa nyid med do zhes pa 'di ni log par rtogs pa rnams kyang mang po zhes pa 'dis shes par byas zin to //
analyzed: 'dir de rnams rab tu grub pa nyid med do zhes pa 'di ni log par rtogs pa rnams kyang mang po zhes pa 'dis shes par byas zin to //
translated: That they are not well established is understood from the many mistaken ideas expressed by the many.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And their characteristics are not stated,

original: gang las rang gi ngo bo shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang las rang gi ngo bo shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because they are known from their own nature.

original: mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir yang chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnam par shes par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir yang chos kyi ngor rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnam par shes par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: Because it has a prior perception, inference and so on are to be understood as being only objects of consciousness in terms of the object of cognition, they are not reasons.

original: de'i phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not mentioned.

original: 'grel pa byed pa ngag byed pa'i dgongs pa gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis mngon sum sngon ma can gang yin pa de tshad ma nyid du rnam par shes par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa ngag byed pa'i dgongs pa gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis mngon sum sngon ma can gang yin pa de tshad ma nyid du rnam par shes par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: The commentators, who clarify the intention of the author, think that this statement, “Because it has a prior perception, it is to be understood as being only a valid cognition,” is also the intention of the author.

original: de'i phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pa 'di yang dgongs par rtog go zhes pa srid par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pa 'di yang dgongs par rtog go zhes pa srid par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they say, “This is also to be understood as the intention.”

original: gzhan du na snga ma yang dgongs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽tshad ma gzhan rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo rnam par ma shes par chos kyi ngor @129a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na snga ma yang dgongs par mi 'gyur ro // tshad ma gzhan rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo rnam par ma shes par chos kyi ngor @129a * //
translated: Otherwise, the previous statement would not be the intention.

original: rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid du rnam par shes par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid du rnam par shes par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Other valid cognitions are not able to understand that the object of cognition is not a reason without first understanding its nature.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'i don du bshad par bya ba rnams su 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'i don du bshad par bya ba rnams su 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, they are explained as being for the sake of understanding their own nature.

original: brjod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But they are not expressions.

original: de'i phyir nges par gang mngon sum sngon ma can de tshad ma nyid du rnam par shes par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par gang mngon sum sngon ma can de tshad ma nyid du rnam par shes par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, it is definitely only that which has a prior perception that is to be understood as valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pa 'di yang 'grel pa byed pa rnams kyis ngag byed pa'i dgongs par mngon par brtags pa'o zhes dgongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brjod pa rnams so zhes pa 'di yang 'grel pa byed pa rnams kyis ngag byed pa'i dgongs par mngon par brtags pa'o zhes dgongs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the commentators have imagined that the author of the commentary intended this: “Those that are not expressed.”

original: de las kyang dran pa la sogs pa rnams kyang mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang dran pa la sogs pa rnams kyang mngon sum sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it would follow that memory and so on would also be valid knowledge because they have a prior perception.🔽Inference, verbal testimony,

original: rjes dpag bstan pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: rjes dpag bstan pa la sogs pa //
translated: and so on.

original: zhes sogs pa'i sgras nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go bar bzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes sogs pa'i sgras nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go bar bzung ngo //
translated: The word “and so on” includes analogy and presumption.

original: bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Testimony is of two types:

original: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa'o //
translated: that produced by a person and that not produced by a person.

original: 'dir snga ma bzung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir snga ma bzung ba ste /
translated: Here, the former is accepted.

original: cig shos ni pha rol po rnams kyis kyang mngon sum sngon ma can nyid du mngon bar 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni pha rol po rnams kyis kyang mngon sum sngon ma can nyid du mngon bar 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The other is not at all accepted by the opponent as being a direct perception that has a prior existence.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yul can zhes brjod zin to zhes pa /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yul can zhes brjod zin to zhes pa /
translated: The subject is not common is what has been said.

original: du ma'i ngo bo'i chos can ni //
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo'i chos can ni //
translated: The subject is a multiplicity

original: zhes pa 'dir dbang po'i blo ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yul can du bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir dbang po'i blo ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yul can du bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Here, the cognition of the senses has been established as having a subject that is not common.

original: 'brel pa ni rten du ma can zhes pa la sogs pas 'brel pa thun mong ba nyid du ston cing /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rten du ma can zhes pa la sogs pas 'brel pa thun mong ba nyid du ston cing /
translated: The connection is a basis for a multiplicity, etc. This shows that the connection is common.

original: gang thun mong ba de mngon sum gyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gang thun mong ba de mngon sum gyi yul ma yin te /
translated: That which is common is not the object of direct perception.

original: spyi bzhin 'brel pa yang de lta bu'o zhes khyab byed 'gal ba gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: spyi bzhin 'brel pa yang de lta bu'o zhes khyab byed 'gal ba gsal bar byed do //
translated: The pervasion is made clear by the contradiction of the pervader.

original: spyi yis mthong ba ma yin par //
analyzed: spyi yis mthong ba ma yin par //
translated: The universal is not seen

original: gal te yang spyi zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: gal te yang spyi zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrubs zin to //
translated: If the universal, etc. This has been established.

original: 'di la khyab pa med pa dogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la khyab pa med pa dogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, the doubt that there is no pervasion is not to be raised.

original: gang phyir dbang po'i blo ni dngos po'i yul can du 'dod cing /
analyzed: gang phyir dbang po'i blo ni dngos po'i yul can du 'dod cing /
translated: Because the cognition of the sense faculty is asserted to have an object that is a thing.

original: dngos po yang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po yang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: And a thing is not shared.

original: thun mong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not common.

original: 'brel pa yang thun mong pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang thun mong pa ste /
translated: A connection is common.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is not a thing.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i blo'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i blo'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the object of the cognition of the sense faculty.

original: 'brel pa can rnams kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa can rnams kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The connected, etc.”

original: gal te 'brel pa rnams 'brel pa can gyi ngo bor te /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa rnams 'brel pa can gyi ngo bor te /
translated: If the connections are apprehended as the nature of the connected,

original: ldan pa can dang 'du ba can la sogs pa nyid du gzung bar bya na /
analyzed: ldan pa can dang 'du ba can la sogs pa nyid du gzung bar bya na /
translated: as possessing and as being combined, etc.,

original: de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la nye bar mkho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la nye bar mkho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would be required for inference, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra las nye @129b bar 'jal ba la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra las nye @129b bar 'jal ba la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba'o //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that they would be required for direct perception, etc.

original: gzhan du na gang yang me'i 'brel pa can ma yin pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang yang me'i 'brel pa can ma yin pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Otherwise, since nothing is connected with fire,

original: thog mar me dang du ba 'brel par ma rtogs pas du ba 'dzin pa de yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog mar me dang du ba 'brel par ma rtogs pas du ba 'dzin pa de yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since at first one does not understand the connection between fire and smoke, the apprehension of smoke is also an inference.

original: de rnams de ltar mngon sum yang ma yin no zhes pa /
analyzed: de rnams de ltar mngon sum yang ma yin no zhes pa /
translated: They are not like that, i.e., they are not direct perception.

original: 'brel pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'brel pa can nyid dam 'brel pa yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'brel pa can nyid dam 'brel pa yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they depend on a connection, and because the connection itself or the connected things are not direct perception.

original: dbang po'i blo ni don la lta ba tsam nyid kyi phyir yang 'brel par byed pa'i ngor nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni don la lta ba tsam nyid kyi phyir yang 'brel par byed pa'i ngor nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The cognition of a sense faculty is merely the seeing of an object, and therefore it is not capable of making a connection.

original: de rnams mngon sum gyis 'brel ba can gyi ngo bor 'dzin pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams mngon sum gyis 'brel ba can gyi ngo bor 'dzin pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not possible for them to apprehend the connected things as direct perception.

original: mthong ba dang spyi las mthong ba la sogs pa 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /
analyzed: mthong ba dang spyi las mthong ba la sogs pa 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /
translated: Because seeing and the general are distinguished from seeing, etc.

original: mthong ba ni gang du rtags dang rtags can dag gi 'brel pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni gang du rtags dang rtags can dag gi 'brel pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing is where the connection between the reason and the property-possessor is seen.

original: spyi las mthong ba ni gang du 'ga' zhig tu 'brel pa mthong ba las de'i spyi'i rnam pas dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa'o //🔽sogs pa'i sgras snga ma dang ldan pa las sogs pa rigs can pas brjod pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyi las mthong ba ni gang du 'ga' zhig tu 'brel pa mthong ba las de'i spyi'i rnam pas dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa'o // sogs pa'i sgras snga ma dang ldan pa las sogs pa rigs can pas brjod pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Seeing the universal is when, having seen the relation in some place, one understands the object that is beyond the senses by means of the universal.🔽The words “and so on” are to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”

original: de las zhes pa la sogs pas 'du ba la sogs pa rnams dang / de dang ldan pa'i du ba can la sogs pa rnams 'du ba can la sogs pa'i ngo bos mngon sum ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir /🔽pha rol po'i 'dod pas kyang de la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mngon sum snga ma can nyid med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de las zhes pa la sogs pas 'du ba la sogs pa rnams dang / de dang ldan pa'i du ba can la sogs pa rnams 'du ba can la sogs pa'i ngo bos mngon sum ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir / pha rol po'i 'dod pas kyang de la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mngon sum snga ma can nyid med do zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”

original: de'i 'dod pas ni zhes pa la /🔽de'i 'dod pa smos pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas ni zhes pa la / de'i 'dod pa smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”

original: rang gi 'dod pas ldan pa dang ldan pa can dag kyang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas ldan pa dang ldan pa can dag kyang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “and so on, such as collection” is to be taken as including the various expressions of the Naiyāyikas, such as “having the prior nature.”

original: de khas blangs nas zhes pa /
analyzed: de khas blangs nas zhes pa /
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line

original: de'i sgras de'i 'dod pa sbrel par bya'o //🔽rjes su dpog pa'i rgyu min zhes pa dang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de'i sgras de'i 'dod pa sbrel par bya'o // rjes su dpog pa'i rgyu min zhes pa dang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad pa'am /
translated: The word “its” should be connected with “desire.”🔽The word “not” in “not a cause of inference” is to be connected with “desire.”

original: nges par 'dzin par yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'dzin par yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: Or the word “not” should be taken as a separate word.

original: gtan tshigs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a reason.

original: gnyis dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because there is no difference between the two.

original: 'brel pa can gnyis ka dag la yang ldan pa khyad par med la /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gnyis ka dag la yang ldan pa khyad par med la /
translated: The relation is not different in either of the two related objects.

original: de las kyang me dang du ba gnyis ka yang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las kyang me dang du ba gnyis ka yang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: And from that, both fire and smoke would be the object of understanding and the means of understanding,

original: rnam pa thams cad du yang thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yang thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are related by their own nature in every way.

original: ldan can dag / rang gi ngo bos rtogs bya'ang @130a * //
analyzed: ldan can dag / rang gi ngo bos rtogs bya'ang @130a * //
translated: The related objects are not understood by their own nature.

original: min // zhes pa rang gi ngo bo ni gang 'brel pa mi shes pas kyang gzung bar bya ba du ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: min // zhes pa rang gi ngo bo ni gang 'brel pa mi shes pas kyang gzung bar bya ba du ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The nature of smoke, etc., which is to be grasped even by one who does not know the relation, is not the nature of fire, etc.

original: des ltag par rtogs par 'os pa dag ma yin pas so //
analyzed: des ltag par rtogs par 'os pa dag ma yin pas so //
translated: Because they are not suitable to be understood by the back-scratcher.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / rjes su dpag pa la ma yin //
analyzed: smras pa / rjes su dpag pa la ma yin //
translated: It is said: Not by inference.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: don 'brel pa can gyi ngo bos de dag lhag par rtogs pa dag phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhen smras pa /
analyzed: don 'brel pa can gyi ngo bos de dag lhag par rtogs pa dag phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhen smras pa /
translated: If they are understood by the essence of the related object, they will be helpful. It is said:

original: ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Not so, and so on.

original: dbang po'i blo ni sbyor ba'i yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni sbyor ba'i yul can ma yin la /
translated: The cognition of the sense faculties is not the subject of application,

original: de dang ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes pa 'dis /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes pa 'dis /
translated: and it is not possessed by that. This explains

original: ldan pa can gyi ngo bos ldan pa can dag mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ldan pa can gyi ngo bos ldan pa can dag mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: that by the essence of possession, the possessor is not direct perception.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: That may be so,

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ming mngon sum sngon ma can ma yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ming mngon sum sngon ma can ma yin la /
translated: but the names of inference and so on do not have direct perception as their antecedent.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gang 'dod pa de kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gang 'dod pa de kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: And the definition of those is whatever is asserted without fault,

original: gang las de dgag pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o zhen gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang las de dgag pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o zhen gsungs pa /
translated: from which their negation is not to be expressed. It is said:

original: rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar ston pa dang nye bar 'jal ba rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar ston pa dang nye bar 'jal ba rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Inference, testimony, and analogy and so on.

original: yang ci ltar rang gi bsam pas ma brjod ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang ci ltar rang gi bsam pas ma brjod ce na gsungs pa /
translated: Again, why is it not stated by one's own thought? It is said:

original: 'brel pa gzhan ma bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan ma bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because no other relation is taught.

original: bye brag pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i 'brel pa rnams las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa 'ga' yang nges par bstan pa ni med do //
analyzed: bye brag pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i 'brel pa rnams las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa 'ga' yang nges par bstan pa ni med do //
translated: There is no other relation taught apart from the relations that are accepted by the Vaiśeṣikas and so on.

original: gang yang ri khrod pas rang gi bsam pas rjes su dpag pa 'di brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: gang yang ri khrod pas rang gi bsam pas rjes su dpag pa 'di brjod pa la'o //
translated: Also, regarding what is stated by the hermit, this inference by one's own thought,

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa shes pa'i phyogs gcig mthong ba las phyir phyogs gzhan pa gcig nye ba ma yin pa la blo yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa shes pa'i phyogs gcig mthong ba las phyir phyogs gzhan pa gcig nye ba ma yin pa la blo yin pa'o //
translated: inference is the cognition of one part of a relation from seeing the other part, even when the other part is not present.

original: de rnams pa gnyis te mngon sum gyis 'brel pa mthong ba dang / spyir mthong ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams pa gnyis te mngon sum gyis 'brel pa mthong ba dang / spyir mthong ba zhes pa'o //
translated: That is of two types: seeing the relation by direct perception and seeing in general.

original: de yang bye brag pa'i rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang bye brag pa'i rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: That is only the inference of the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: gal te 'brel pa de rnams kho na brjod par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa de rnams kho na brjod par 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the relation is stated,

original: 'o na de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo gzhan nges par bstan pa ma yin no zhes pas rjes su dpag pa nges par ma bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo gzhan nges par bstan pa ma yin no zhes pas rjes su dpag pa nges par ma bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: then the nature of the relation is not stated. Thus, the inference is not stated at all.

original: dran pa yang phyogs gcig tu mthong ba las phyogs gzhan pa gcig po sngar rtogs pa la skye'o zhes pas /
analyzed: dran pa yang phyogs gcig tu mthong ba las phyogs gzhan pa gcig po sngar rtogs pa la skye'o zhes pas /
translated: Memory arises from seeing one part of an object and remembering another part.

original: de yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, memory is also an inference.

original: 'brel pa yang dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And it has been explained that the relation is not perceived by the senses.

original: des na ci'i phyir de mngon sum gyis 'brel pa @130b mthong ba nyid yin zhes pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir de mngon sum gyis 'brel pa @130b mthong ba nyid yin zhes pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: So why do you say that the relation is perceived by the senses? This is not reasonable.

original: don gyis go ba dang dngos po med pa dag gi dgag pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa /
analyzed: don gyis go ba dang dngos po med pa dag gi dgag pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa /
translated: We must explain the negation of suggestion and non-entity.

original: de dag rang gi 'dod pas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rang gi 'dod pas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are stated by the desire of the speaker.

original: phru ba la sogs pa dang rten par byed pa la sogs pa'i don gyis bzung ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: phru ba la sogs pa dang rten par byed pa la sogs pa'i don gyis bzung ba zhes pa la /
translated: The meaning of “pot” and so on is grasped by the word “pot” and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgra gcig gis thal ba dang skya bo la sogs pa'i sgrub byed kyi bye brag rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra gcig gis thal ba dang skya bo la sogs pa'i sgrub byed kyi bye brag rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The single word “etc.” includes the specific proofs of “burnt” and “pale,” and so on.

original: gnyis pas kyang chu len pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pas kyang chu len pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams so //
translated: The second “etc.” includes the specific actions of “carrying water,” and so on.

original: don smos pa nyid ni tshos pa ni de las skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don smos pa nyid ni tshos pa ni de las skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of “burnt” is stated because it is produced from that.

original: de rnams med pas tshos pa 'grub par mi 'gyur pas so //
analyzed: de rnams med pas tshos pa 'grub par mi 'gyur pas so //
translated: Since those do not exist, “burnt” is not established.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du ni mi 'thad bas de thams cad don gyis bzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du ni mi 'thad bas de thams cad don gyis bzung ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable as anything else, all of that is only implicitly included.

original: yang ci ltar rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: yang ci ltar rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, how is it an inference?

original: ji tsam gyis tshul gsum pa'i rtags las don mthong ba rjes su dpag par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis tshul gsum pa'i rtags las don mthong ba rjes su dpag par brjod do zhe na /
translated: By how much is the meaning seen from the trimodal reason called an inference?

original: 'tshed pa'i rtags nyid las rtogs par bya ba zhes pa /
analyzed: 'tshed pa'i rtags nyid las rtogs par bya ba zhes pa /
translated: It is said that “cooking” is to be understood from the very sign of cooking.

original: 'tshod pa ni phru ba la sogs pa rnams la med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtags so //
analyzed: 'tshod pa ni phru ba la sogs pa rnams la med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtags so //
translated: Cooking is the reason because it does not occur without the pot, and so on.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-occurrence without that is because it is produced from that.

original: de'i phyir du ba las me rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rtags las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad ba ma yin no //🔽gzhan rnams ni yod pa dang med pa dag las /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba las me rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rtags las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad ba ma yin no // gzhan rnams ni yod pa dang med pa dag las /
translated: Therefore, because it is produced from a reason, like inferring fire from smoke, it is not different from inference.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu rtogs ba don gyis go bar 'dod la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu rtogs ba don gyis go bar 'dod la /
translated: Others assert that the understanding of effect and cause from existence and nonexistence is understood by implication.

original: gzhan rnams ni de kho na rigs pa zhes bya ba tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni de kho na rigs pa zhes bya ba tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes te /
translated: Others say that that very logic is another valid means of knowledge.

original: dper na mig yod na mig gi rnam par shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na mig yod na mig gi rnam par shes par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, when the eye exists, eye consciousness arises.

original: med na ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: med na ni 'gyur te /
translated: When it does not exist, it does not arise.

original: de'i phyir mig ni de'i rgyu kho na'o zhes pa'o //🔽'di ni rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig ni de'i rgyu kho na'o zhes pa'o // 'di ni rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the eye is its cause alone.

original: dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not logical to infer because there is no example.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis dpe grub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis dpe grub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Another valid means of knowledge would establish the example.

original: 'dir tshad ma gzhan gyis dpe 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshad ma gzhan gyis dpe 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But here another valid means of knowledge does not establish the example.

original: de ltar ni gang yang sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa 'di dpe nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar ni gang yang sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa 'di dpe nyid du 'dod na /
translated: In that case, if seed and sprout, etc. are asserted as the example,

original: der yang 'di kho nas 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po 'grub cing /
analyzed: der yang 'di kho nas 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po 'grub cing /
translated: And in that case, the very same thing that establishes the entity of cause and effect🔽would also be the example.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable,

original: gang gis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa de kho nas dpe yang ngo zhes pas na dpe thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gang gis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa de kho nas dpe yang ngo zhes pas na dpe thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because the very same thing that establishes what is to be established would be the example, and that would lead to an infinite regress of examples.

original: de yang tshad ma gzhan ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma gzhan ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not another valid cognition,

original: 'dir 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: because here the entity of cause and effect is not to be established.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba @131a * //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba @131a * //
translated: What is to be established

original: dang sgrub par byed pa dag tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang sgrub par byed pa dag tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the means of establishing it are not different.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni yod pa dang med pa dag las gzhan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni yod pa dang med pa dag las gzhan pa ma yin la /
translated: The entity of cause and effect is not other than existent and nonexistent,

original: de kho nas de bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'thad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho nas de bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'thad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not tenable that it is established by that very thing.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rmongs pa'i ngor skyed par byed par rjod pas na pha nyid bzhin du yul bstan pas yul can 'brel pa zhugs pa dran par byed pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba ste /🔽gang 'dra ba'i yul du khyod kyis gzhan la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tha snyad zhugs pa de 'dra ba kho na 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rmongs pa'i ngor skyed par byed par rjod pas na pha nyid bzhin du yul bstan pas yul can 'brel pa zhugs pa dran par byed pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba ste / gang 'dra ba'i yul du khyod kyis gzhan la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tha snyad zhugs pa de 'dra ba kho na 'di yin te /
translated: The object is just like the father, since the expression is established by teaching the object.

original: de'i phyir 'di la yang 'jug par byos shig ces tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la dpe srid do zhes pas rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yang 'jug par byos shig ces tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la dpe srid do zhes pas rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: “Just as you have used the expressions ‘effect’ and ‘cause’ in regard to an object that is similar, you should also use them in regard to this object.” Since the example is possible in the proof of the expression, it is only an inference.

original: sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni /
translated: The syllogism is:

original: gang du de yod pa na yod pa nyid de la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tha snyad bya ste /
analyzed: gang du de yod pa na yod pa nyid de la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tha snyad bya ste /
translated: “Where the effect exists, the cause exists, and the expressions ‘effect’ and ‘cause’ are used in regard to that.

original: dper na gang du sngar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rab tu zhugs pas sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa la bzhin /
analyzed: dper na gang du sngar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rab tu zhugs pas sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa la bzhin /
translated: For example, where the state of cause and effect is already engaged, as in the case of a seed and a sprout, etc.

original: mig dang de'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang de yod na yod pa nyid yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang de'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang de yod na yod pa nyid yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: and the eye and its consciousness exist when it exists.

original: ri khrod pa na re don gyis go ba yang mthong ba'am thos pa'i don rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes pas don gyis yongs su rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ri khrod pa na re don gyis go ba yang mthong ba'am thos pa'i don rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes pas don gyis yongs su rtogs pa ste /
translated: The forest-dweller says: One also understands by the meaning, because it is not tenable that the meaning of what is seen or heard is otherwise.

original: dper na lhas byin 'tsho ba na khang par ma mthong bas phyi rol na yod pa ma mthong ba yang rtogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin 'tsho ba na khang par ma mthong bas phyi rol na yod pa ma mthong ba yang rtogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, when Devadatta is alive, one understands that he is not seen outside the house because he is not seen there.

original: 'dir ba lang dang bong bu'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: 'dir ba lang dang bong bu'i tshul gyis /
translated: Here, by the method of the cow and the donkey,

original: sgra las khong du chud pa ni thos pa'i sgras logs su nye bar blangs pa'i phyir mthong ba'i sgra tshad ma gzhan gyis nye bar dmigs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sgra las khong du chud pa ni thos pa'i sgras logs su nye bar blangs pa'i phyir mthong ba'i sgra tshad ma gzhan gyis nye bar dmigs pa la 'jug go //
translated: understanding from the word is that, because the word heard is taken separately, the word seen is engaged in the observation of another valid knowledge.

original: dper na 'tsho ba na zhes pa dngos po med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba'i dper brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'tsho ba na zhes pa dngos po med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba'i dper brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when alive is an example of understanding by the meaning that precedes the non-existent thing.

original: khyim na ma mthong bas phyi rol na yod pa zhes pa ni 'tsho ba can gyi lhas byin khyim na ma mthong ba'i dngos po med pa'i tshad mas nye bar dmigs pa ni phyi rol na yod pa las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don🔽to // 'dir gal te 'tsho ba can gyi lhas byin khyim na ma mthong ba ni phyi rol na yod pa las rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas na gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya la /
analyzed: khyim na ma mthong bas phyi rol na yod pa zhes pa ni 'tsho ba can gyi lhas byin khyim na ma mthong ba'i dngos po med pa'i tshad mas nye bar dmigs pa ni phyi rol na yod pa las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to // 'dir gal te 'tsho ba can gyi lhas byin khyim na ma mthong ba ni phyi rol na yod pa las rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas na gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya la /
translated: The meaning of “not seen in the house, he exists outside” is that the valid cognition that observes the absence of the thing not seen in the house by Devadatta the householder is not tenable as anything other than his existence outside.🔽Here, if it is said that Devadatta the householder is not seen in the house, and it is said that “it is not tenable that he exists elsewhere,” then it is not seen that he exists elsewhere.

original: de ltar gyur na phyi rol na yod pa dang med na mi 'byung bar yang de mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas /🔽de ltar na yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na phyi rol na yod pa dang med na mi 'byung bar yang de mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas /🔽de ltar na yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is the case, then it is not tenable that he is seen to exist outside and that he does not exist when not seen.

original: ci ste lhas byin gson pa khang pa na ma mthong @131b ba ni phyi rol na yod par gyur pa kho na la mthong gi de med na yang mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas rnam pa gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya na
analyzed: ci ste lhas byin gson pa khang pa na ma mthong @131b ba ni phyi rol na yod par gyur pa kho na la mthong gi de med na yang mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas rnam pa gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya na
translated: But if you say, “When Lhejin is not seen in the house, he is seen only as existing outside, and even if he does not exist, he is not seen,” then you must say that it is not tenable to see him in any other way.

original: / de'i tshe de yod pa kho na gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: / de'i tshe de yod pa kho na gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, you would be saying that it is not tenable for him to exist in any other way.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi don kho na la 'gyur ro zhes pas don gyis go ba rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi don kho na la 'gyur ro zhes pas don gyis go ba rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: And that would be the meaning of the inference that is understood by implication. Thus, it is not different from inference.

original: sbyor ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa khang pa nam dmigs shing 'tsho ba dang ldan pa de ni phyi rol na yod de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa khang pa nam dmigs shing 'tsho ba dang ldan pa de ni phyi rol na yod de /
translated: The syllogism is: “The subject, the house, when it is observed and the living Lhejin is not observed in it, exists outside,

original: dper na ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa can phyi rol na nye bar dmigs pa'i mchod sbyin bzhin /
analyzed: dper na ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa can phyi rol na nye bar dmigs pa'i mchod sbyin bzhin /
translated: because it is observed outside in the way that has been explained, like the sacrifice that is observed outside in the way that has been explained.”

original: sgra las khong du chud pa'i yod pa can lhas byin yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra las khong du chud pa'i yod pa can lhas byin yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: The existence of Devadatta, who is understood from the word, is endowed with the properties as explained. This is the nature.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir zhes pa /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir zhes pa /
translated: Because it is the cause of doubt,

original: gang the tshom gyi rgyu de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang the tshom gyi rgyu de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: that which is the cause of doubt is not a means of valid cognition,

original: gzhal bya nyid bzhin /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid bzhin /
translated: like the object of doubt itself.

original: ma nges pa'i don gyis go ba yang de lta bu'o zhes khyab byed dang 'gal ba gsungs so //🔽nag pa khyim na med pa las //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i don gyis go ba yang de lta bu'o zhes khyab byed dang 'gal ba gsungs so // nag pa khyim na med pa las //
translated: The understanding by means of an indefinite object is also like that. Thus he states the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word not in not in the house and so on,

original: khang pa na med pa tsam gyis nag pa phyi rol na yod par rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khang pa na med pa tsam gyis nag pa phyi rol na yod par rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: is not understood to mean that the cow is outside merely by its absence in the house.

original: gzhan du na ri bong gi rva'i yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ri bong gi rva'i yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the horn of a rabbit would also be so.

original: khyim gyi sgra ngag de la rab tu sbyar bas ni /
analyzed: khyim gyi sgra ngag de la rab tu sbyar bas ni /
translated: By applying the word house to that,

original: de phyi rol na yod pa go bar byed de /
analyzed: de phyi rol na yod pa go bar byed de /
translated: it is understood that it is outside.

original: khyim gyi sgra rab tu sbyar na ni ngag 'dis med pa nges pa dang ldan par brjod par byed do //
analyzed: khyim gyi sgra rab tu sbyar na ni ngag 'dis med pa nges pa dang ldan par brjod par byed do //
translated: When the word house is applied, this statement is made with the ascertainment of absence.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i don brjod par 'dod pa kho na la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i don brjod par 'dod pa kho na la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because only one who desires to express the meaning in that way would employ a statement in that way.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te khyim dang phyi rol na yang med par gyur na ni med do zhes pa kho na brjod par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gal te khyim dang phyi rol na yang med par gyur na ni med do zhes pa kho na brjod par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: If it were not to exist in the house and outside, then one should say only that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir ngag 'dis ni khyim na med pa dang phyi rol na yod pa gnyis ka 'phen par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag 'dis ni khyim na med pa dang phyi rol na yod pa gnyis ka 'phen par byed de /
translated: Therefore, this statement implies both that it does not exist in the house and that it exists outside.

original: nges par sbyor ba 'chad par byed pa gcig kyang gnyis pa 'phen pa med na mi 'byung ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba 'chad par byed pa gcig kyang gnyis pa 'phen pa med na mi 'byung ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even a single statement that explains a negative statement implies the second when it has the nature of a negative statement.

original: med pa 'ba' zhig pa ni phyi rol na yod pa 'phen pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa 'ba' zhig pa ni phyi rol na yod pa 'phen pa ma yin la /
translated: A mere nonexistence does not imply that it exists outside.

original: nges pa dang ldan pa yang 'ba' zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa dang ldan pa yang 'ba' zhig pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does a mere statement that has the nature of a negative statement.

original: nges pa ni gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because a negative statement has the nature of both.

original: de'i phyir nag pa khang pa na med do zhes pa dngos po med pa kho na brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir nag pa khang pa na med do zhes pa dngos po med pa kho na brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when one says that a cow does not exist in the house, one is not merely stating a nonentity.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol na yod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol na yod pa yang ngo //
translated: But it is not the case that it is not external.

original: de'i phyir don gyis go ba kho na dngos po med pa zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis go ba kho na dngos po med pa zhes pa /
translated: Therefore, the mere implication of the object is the non-existence.

original: dper na snod la sogs pa med par chos pa @132a * //
analyzed: dper na snod la sogs pa med par chos pa @132a * //
translated: For example, it is not possible to establish the existence of a pot without the non-existence of a cloth.

original: yongs su 'grub pa srid pa ma yin no zhes pas med na med pa nyid kyi phyir de ni de 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su 'grub pa srid pa ma yin no zhes pas med na med pa nyid kyi phyir de ni de 'phen par byed do //
translated: Since the non-existence of the cloth is the cause of the existence of the pot, it is the impeller of the pot.

original: de bzhin du dgag pa nges par brjod par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgag pa nges par brjod par 'dod pa na /
translated: In the same way, when one wishes to express negation,

original: khyim gyi sgra rab tu sbyor ba ni phyi rol na yod pa med na srid pa ma yin no zhes pas med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir de ni de 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: khyim gyi sgra rab tu sbyor ba ni phyi rol na yod pa med na srid pa ma yin no zhes pas med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir de ni de 'phen par byed do //
translated: the application of the word “house” is not possible without the non-existence of the external. Since the non-existence of the external is the cause of the existence of the house, it is the impeller of the house.

original: de'i phyir yang ji ltar 'tshod pa ni phru ba la sogs pa'i rtags yin pa de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ji ltar 'tshod pa ni phru ba la sogs pa'i rtags yin pa de ltar /
translated: Therefore, just as cooking is the mark of the pot, etc.,

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag gi cha shas kyi khang pa'i sgra yang phyi rol na yod pa'i'o zhes pas de las de rtogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag gi cha shas kyi khang pa'i sgra yang phyi rol na yod pa'i'o zhes pas de las de rtogs so //
translated: in the same way, the word “house” is the part of speech that has this form. Since the word “house” is the non-existence of the external, it is understood from that.

original: ri khrod pa na re dngos po med pa yang tshad ma'i dngos po med pa ni med do zhes pa phrad pa med pa'i don no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ri khrod pa na re dngos po med pa yang tshad ma'i dngos po med pa ni med do zhes pa phrad pa med pa'i don no zhes zer ro //
translated: The hermit says that the non-existence of a thing is not the non-existence of a thing that is a valid cognition.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga med pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga med pa ni /
translated: The non-existence of the five valid cognitions such as direct perception

original: dbang po dang phrad pa med pa'i don med do zhes pa dngos po med pa la nges pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang phrad pa med pa'i don med do zhes pa dngos po med pa la nges pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: is not the meaning of non-contact with the sense faculties. Thus, the non-existence of a thing becomes the cause of ascertainment.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa tshad ma'o zhes pa ngag gi don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa tshad ma'o zhes pa ngag gi don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement the non-existence of a thing is a valid cognition is this.

original: de kho na ma dmigs pa'i sgras tha snyad du byed pa las tshad ma gzhan du smra ba gzhan rnams smra bar byed de /
analyzed: de kho na ma dmigs pa'i sgras tha snyad du byed pa las tshad ma gzhan du smra ba gzhan rnams smra bar byed de /
translated: Those who propound other valid cognitions than direct perception and so on make statements such as:

original: nye bar dmigs pa gang gis don //🔽gang zhig shes pa de med las //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa gang gis don // gang zhig shes pa de med las //
translated: By the non-apprehension of an object,🔽that which is known as non-existent,

original: med nyid shes pa de yis ni //
analyzed: med nyid shes pa de yis ni //
translated: by that knowledge of non-existence,

original: 'di ni mi dmigs yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs yin par 'dod //
translated: this is asserted to be non-apprehension.

original: ces so // 'di la yang tshad ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // 'di la yang tshad ma med pa'o //
translated: Here too, there is no valid cognition.

original: ma bzung ba ni dngos po med pa 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bzung ba ni dngos po med pa 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: What is not apprehended does not become the cause of apprehending non-existence.

original: ci ste 'dzin pa la ltos pa de dngos po med pa 'dzin pa la bya ba byed na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'dzin pa la ltos pa de dngos po med pa 'dzin pa la bya ba byed na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the non-entity that is dependent on the apprehension were to perform a function in the apprehension, there would be an infinite regress.

original: ji ltar bum pa med pa tshad ma med pas 'dzin pa de ltar tshad ma med pa yang gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa med pa tshad ma med pas 'dzin pa de ltar tshad ma med pa yang gzhan gyis te /
translated: Just as the non-entity of a pot is apprehended by the non-entity of a valid cognition, so the non-entity of a valid cognition is apprehended by another [non-entity],

original: de yang gzhan gyis so zhes pas thug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis so zhes pas thug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and that by another, and so on. Thus, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gcig 'dzin pa med pa na yang thams cad kyi 'dzin pa med pa'o zhes pas na de ga las tshad ma nyid yin /
analyzed: gcig 'dzin pa med pa na yang thams cad kyi 'dzin pa med pa'o zhes pas na de ga las tshad ma nyid yin /
translated: And if there is no apprehension of one, there is no apprehension of all. Therefore, how could it be a valid cognition?

original: gal te ma bzung ba yang dbang po bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma bzung ba yang dbang po bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it were so, then like the sense faculties, the non-apprehended would also become the cause of apprehension.

original: med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: No, because non-existence is characterized by the absence of all abilities.

original: gzhan du na yod pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na yod pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be existent.

original: yod pa ni don bya ba nus pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pas dngos po med pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni don bya ba nus pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pas dngos po med pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because existence is characterized by the ability to perform a function. Therefore, non-entity is not a valid cognition.

original: 'o na khyed la yang mi dmigs pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na khyed la yang mi dmigs pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, non-apprehension would not be a valid cognition for you,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon kho na'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon kho na'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because of the very faults that have been explained.

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir kho bos rnam pa 'di lta bu'i @132b mi dmigs pa 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bos rnam pa 'di lta bu'i @132b mi dmigs pa 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because we do not accept non-apprehension in this way.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: But rather, it is the non-apprehension of that which has the characteristics of apprehension.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: That which has the characteristics of apprehension

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba dang rang bzhin khyad par can te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba dang rang bzhin khyad par can te /
translated: is the complete assemblage of the other conditions of apprehension and a special nature.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan rnams yod pa na yod pa mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan rnams yod pa na yod pa mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That nature which, when the other conditions of apprehension are present, is only manifest when it is present.

original: de la dmigs pa ni byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba'am las la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba'am las la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the object of apprehension is either the action that resides in the agent or the action that resides in the object.

original: brtags pa snga ma la dmigs par byed bzhin pa'i chos shes pa ni dmigs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: brtags pa snga ma la dmigs par byed bzhin pa'i chos shes pa ni dmigs pa yin zhing /
translated: In the former case, the object of apprehension is the cognition of the dharma that is being apprehended.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin te brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin te brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The non-apprehension of any other object is non-apprehension, because it is just the non-apprehension of the object that is intended.

original: bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang reg par bya ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang reg par bya ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the non-edible and the non-touchable.

original: gang gi tshe las la gnas pa'i bya ba dmigs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de'i tshe nye bar dmigs par bya bzhin pa kho na'o chos rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed bar rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni dmigs pa yin zhing yul gyi
analyzed: gang gi tshe las la gnas pa'i bya ba dmigs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de'i tshe nye bar dmigs par bya bzhin pa kho na'o chos rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed bar rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni dmigs pa yin zhing yul gyi
translated: When the activity of the agent who is engaged in the object is expressed by the word “apprehension,” then the object is that which is being apprehended, which is characterized by the mere suitability for generating a cognition that has it as its object.

original: rang bzhin kho na ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin kho na ste /
translated: It is just the nature of the object.

original: rung ba nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because suitability is just the nature of an entity.

original: de las gzhan pa dmigs par rung ba de dang shes pa gcig la 'brel ba'i rang bzhin kho na mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dmigs par rung ba de dang shes pa gcig la 'brel ba'i rang bzhin kho na mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of anything other than that which is suitable is just the non-apprehension of that which is related to the same cognition.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa de dang de rnam pa gnyis ka yang mngon sum kho nas 'grub bo zhes pas kho bo cag la ji skad brjod pa'i skyon srid ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa de dang de rnam pa gnyis ka yang mngon sum kho nas 'grub bo zhes pas kho bo cag la ji skad brjod pa'i skyon srid ba ma yin no //
translated: The non-observation explained above and the two aspects are established by direct perception alone. Therefore, the faults that you ascribe to us are not possible.

original: 'o na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i mi dmigs pa tshad mar 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i mi dmigs pa tshad mar 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: Well, granted that non-observation such as this is a valid cognition.

original: yang de ci ltar rjes su dpag par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang de ci ltar rjes su dpag par 'gyur /
translated: But how can it be an inference?

original: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why can't it be?

original: dpe la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not rely on an example.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la dpe 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la dpe 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas te /
translated: Because there is no example at all for this.

original: tshad mas grub pa dper 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa dper 'gyur bas so //
translated: For an example is something established by valid cognition.

original: gzhan du na gal te dpe mi dmigs pas grub pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te dpe mi dmigs pas grub pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, if non-observation were established by an example,

original: de ltar gyur na ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: ji ltar bum pa med pa dpes bsgrub par bya ba de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa med pa dpes bsgrub par bya ba de ltar /
translated: just as the nonexistence of a pot is established by an example,

original: dpe nye bar brjod pa med pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa yang dpe gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: dpe nye bar brjod pa med pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa yang dpe gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: so too the sky flower and so on, which are not mentioned as examples, would be established by another example.

original: de yang gzhan gyis so zhes pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis so zhes pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you say that another consciousness is the object of the first consciousness, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste dpe ni dpe med par yang 'grub na bum pa med par yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste dpe ni dpe med par yang 'grub na bum pa med par yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that an example is established even without an example, then a pot would be established even without an example.

original: de'i phyir yang mi dmigs pa tshad ma gzhan kho @133a * //🔽nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mi dmigs pa tshad ma gzhan kho @133a * // nar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension is a separate means of valid cognition.🔽Because it does not rely on an example.

original: dpe la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: dpe la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist,

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa bsgrub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa bsgrub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: because non-apprehension does not establish the non-existence of a thing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: med pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The convention of non-existence.

original: dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of what is suitable to be apprehended is the reason for the convention of non-existence.

original: de ni rang nyid nye ba las rang gi rgyu mtshan can 'di ltar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid nye ba las rang gi rgyu mtshan can 'di ltar sgrub par byed do //
translated: That itself, being present, establishes its own reason in this way.

original: rang gi rgyu mtshan tshogs par 'byung ba can thams cad 'dir dpe'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu mtshan tshogs par 'byung ba can thams cad 'dir dpe'o //
translated: All that occurs in the assembly of its own reason is an example here.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la yang /
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la yang /
translated: In the proof of the negation of the convention of existence,

original: mi dmigs pa dang cig shos kyis te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang cig shos kyis te /
translated: it is by non-apprehension and the other.

original: rgyu mtshan dang bral na mi 'byung ba can myu gu la sogs pa rnams kyang dpe'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang bral na mi 'byung ba can myu gu la sogs pa rnams kyang dpe'o //
translated: The sprouts, etc., which are not produced in the absence of a cause, are the example.

original: nye bar brjod pa med pa 'ba' zhig kho na ni ma yin no zhes pas tshad ma gzhan nyid du thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa med pa 'ba' zhig kho na ni ma yin no zhes pas tshad ma gzhan nyid du thal ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is no expression at all, and so it is not the case that there is an absurd consequence of another valid cognition.

original: yang dngos po med pa kho na bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang dngos po med pa kho na bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it that the non-existence of a thing is not the probandum?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction.

original: de ltar ni dmigs pa kho na bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams kyi yod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni dmigs pa kho na bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams kyi yod pa ste /
translated: In this way, the existence of those things that are suitable to be seen is only the object of perception.

original: mi dmigs pa yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang med pa nyid do //
translated: Non-perception is also non-existence.

original: ci ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe rung ba nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes pa 'di grub
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe rung ba nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes pa 'di grub
translated: First, when the object is suitable to produce the consciousness that has it as its object, as explained, at that time, because it has become the nature of suitability, the object is existence. This is established.

original: bo // gang gi tshe yang byed pa po'i chos shes pa ni dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe yang de ni bltar rung ba'i don gyi yod pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa nyid kyi phyir la /
analyzed: bo // gang gi tshe yang byed pa po'i chos shes pa ni dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe yang de ni bltar rung ba'i don gyi yod pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa nyid kyi phyir la /
translated: When the attribute of the agent is known, then at that time, since that is the reason for the existence of the object that is suitable to be seen,

original: des na khyab pa dang ldog pa dag gis de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med do zhes pas yod pa dang 'dra bar nye bar btags pa las yod pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: des na khyab pa dang ldog pa dag gis de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med do zhes pas yod pa dang 'dra bar nye bar btags pa las yod pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: therefore, by the pervasion and the reverse pervasion, there is no difference between that and its nature and its particularities. Thus, it is only existence, since it is a designation as similar to existence.

original: de ltar gnyis ka ltar na yang yod pa nyid ni dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ka ltar na yang yod pa nyid ni dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In that way, in both cases, existence is the observed object.

original: de med pa yang med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de med pa yang med pa nyid yin te /
translated: And the nonexistence of that is nonexistence.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the engagement of an implicative negation.

original: snga ma bzhin no //🔽de kho na yang mi dmigs pa'o zhes pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag la bye brag med do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no // de kho na yang mi dmigs pa'o zhes pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag la bye brag med do //
translated: It is as before.🔽Since that is the observed object, there is no difference between the probandum and the proof.

original: des na mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nonobservation does not prove the nonexistence of a thing.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan nye bar mthong ba na med do zhes mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad rmongs pa'i ngor bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan nye bar mthong ba na med do zhes mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad rmongs pa'i ngor bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, when the reason is seen, the expression of nonexistence is established for the confused one from nonapprehension, by saying “it does not exist.”

original: skyed par byed par rjod pas pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed par rjod pas pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like the expression of nonfatherhood.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas kyang rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir tha snyad 'gog ste /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas kyang rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir tha snyad 'gog ste /
translated: Also, the expression of nonexistence is stopped by nonapprehension of the nonappearing, because there is no reason.

original: skyed par byed pa ma @133b yin par brjod pas pha nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma @133b yin par brjod pas pha nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is like the expression of nonfatherhood.

original: gang gzhan gyi phyogs bkag pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi phyogs bkag pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The refutation of the opponent’s position, etc., is as follows.

original: bshad 'grel byed pas gang brjod pa /
analyzed: bshad 'grel byed pas gang brjod pa /
translated: The author of the commentary says:

original: pha rol gyi phyogs bkag pas rang gi phyogs 'grub bo zhes pa de dgag pa grangs can pa'i bsal te 'ongs pa dgag pa kho na las byas zin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi phyogs bkag pas rang gi phyogs 'grub bo zhes pa de dgag pa grangs can pa'i bsal te 'ongs pa dgag pa kho na las byas zin par rig par bya ste /
