translated: “The establishment of one’s own position is by the refutation of the opponent’s position.” This is refuted by the Sāṃkhya. It should be understood that it is already done by the mere refutation of the coming.

original: 'di yang bsal te 'ongs pa'i sbyor ba kho na'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: 'di yang bsal te 'ongs pa'i sbyor ba kho na'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: This is also just the application of the refutation of the coming.

original: le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter.

original: // / rang gi don dang gzhan don gyi dbye bas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes brjod la /
analyzed: // / rang gi don dang gzhan don gyi dbye bas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes brjod la /
translated: The two kinds of inference are stated to be the two kinds, that for one's own purpose and that for the purpose of others.

original: de la rang gi don bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la rang gi don bshad zin to //
translated: Of those, that for one's own purpose has been explained.

original: da ni gzhan don gtan la 'bebs par 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gzhan don gtan la 'bebs par 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to establish that for the purpose of others, he says:

original: gzhan don zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan don zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That for the purpose of others and so on.

original: rang don ni rjes su dpag pa nyid dngos yin la /
analyzed: rang don ni rjes su dpag pa nyid dngos yin la /
translated: That for one's own purpose is the inference itself,

original: 'di ni nye bar btags pa'o zhes khyad par gyi don la ni'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar btags pa'o zhes khyad par gyi don la ni'i sgra'o //
translated: and this is a metaphorical designation, the word ni having the sense of distinction.

original: rang nyid kyis mthong ba ni rang gis mthong ba'o //🔽rang gis mthong ba yang 'di yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis mthong ba ni rang gis mthong ba'o // rang gis mthong ba yang 'di yin la /
translated: Seen by oneself is seen by one's own [mind].🔽  It is seen by oneself,

original: don yang yin pas rang gis mthong don te /
analyzed: don yang yin pas rang gis mthong don te /
translated: and it is an object, so it is an object seen by oneself,

original: tshul gsum pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: a reason having the three modes.

original: de tshig gang gis gsal bar byed pa de ni gzhan don rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de tshig gang gis gsal bar byed pa de ni gzhan don rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: That by which it is clarified is the inference for the purpose of others.

original: yang de ci ltar gzhan gyi don nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang de ci ltar gzhan gyi don nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, how is it just for the purpose of others? He says:

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as and so on.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Well, then, the cognition that has as its object the object to be inferred is the inference,

original: shes pa kho na tshad ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa kho na tshad ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because only cognition is the valid cognition.

original: des na ci ltar tshig rjes su dpag pa nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na ci ltar tshig rjes su dpag pa nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: So how can the statement be the inference? It is said:

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /
translated: Because the effect is figuratively designated to the cause.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pas ni pha rol po rnams la rtags ma rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pas ni pha rol po rnams la rtags ma rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: By stating the reason having the three modes, the reason is not understood by the opponents.

original: de las kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: And from that, the object to be inferred is understood.

original: de'i phyir de brgyud pas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes pas rgyu de la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa las de rjes su dpag pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de brgyud pas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes pas rgyu de la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa las de rjes su dpag pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that [statement] becomes the cause of the inference indirectly. Thus, from figuratively designating the effect to the cause, it should be called inference.

original: 'dir brtsad pa /
analyzed: 'dir brtsad pa /
translated: Here, there is a debate:

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa zhes pa 'di tsam zhig kho na mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa zhes pa 'di tsam zhig kho na mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: This much alone, stating the reason having the three modes, would be the definition.

original: rang gis mthong ngon smos pa'i don ci yin pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ngon smos pa'i don ci yin pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of stating what one has seen oneself? It should be stated.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will explain.

original: kha cig 'di skad du smra ste /🔽gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad du smra ste / gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Some say this:

original: rang gis ma mthong yang pa rol po rnams kyis lung las mthong ba ni sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang gis ma mthong yang pa rol po rnams kyis lung las mthong ba ni sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Even though one does not see it oneself, the testimony of others is a proof, because it is to be understood by another.

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa rnams sam blo ni @134a * //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa rnams sam blo ni @134a * //
translated: For example, like the pleasure, etc., or the mind,

original: sems pa med pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa rnams te /
translated: which are not conscious,

original: skye ba'i phyir ram mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir ram mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because they are produced or because they are impermanent,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: like form, etc.

original: de'i phyir de'i lung las pha rol pos mthong ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du rang smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i lung las pha rol pos mthong ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du rang smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to make it known that the testimony of others is not a proof, he mentions himself.

original: ci'i phyir de sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a proof?

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the domain of inference, which proceeds by the power of fact, testimony is not a valid cognition.

original: ci ste lung tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste lung tshad ma yin na /
translated: But if testimony is a valid cognition,

original: 'o na des grub pa pha rol po kho na la grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na des grub pa pha rol po kho na la grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not established for the opponent by that.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar tshad mar gyur pa'i lung de las pha rol pos bde ba la sogs pa rnams skye ba can dang / mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa de ltar sems pa dang bcas pa nyid du spang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar tshad mar gyur pa'i lung de las pha rol pos bde ba la sogs pa rnams skye ba can dang / mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa de ltar sems pa dang bcas pa nyid du spang ste /
translated: Moreover, just as the opponent does not establish that pleasure and so on are impermanent and have arising by means of a valid scripture, he also does not establish that they are conscious.

original: de'i phyir de la gnod par byed pa'i rjes dpag 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gnod par byed pa'i rjes dpag 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent’s inference that refutes that is not engaged.

original: 'jug na yang de'i des gnod bzhin pa ni ci ltar lung tshad ma yin /
analyzed: 'jug na yang de'i des gnod bzhin pa ni ci ltar lung tshad ma yin /
translated: Even if it were engaged, how could it be a valid scripture when it is being refuted by that?

original: des na lung la pha rol pos khas blangs pa ni sgrub byed ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lung la pha rol pos khas blangs pa ni sgrub byed ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent’s acceptance of scripture is not a proof.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa ma yin na de dang der thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub byed brjod pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa ma yin na de dang der thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub byed brjod pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not a proof, how can it be a statement of a proof that is a consequence of that?

original: 'di skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skyon ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault.

original: gang gi phyir gang pha rol pos brtags pa rnams kyis thal 'gyur du bya ba dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du'o zhes pa lta bu de ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang pha rol pos brtags pa rnams kyis thal 'gyur du bya ba dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du'o zhes pa lta bu de ni /
translated: Because of that, the reductio that the opponent intends to state, for example, “Space and so on are impermanent because they exist,” is not a correct reductio.

original: chos gcig khas blangs pa na chos gzhan khas blangs par bstan pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: chos gcig khas blangs pa na chos gzhan khas blangs par bstan pa'i don du ste /
translated: Because of that, the purpose of the reductio is to show that when one of two things is accepted, the other must also be accepted, as in the case of the non-Buddhist’s reductio against the Buddhist, “The impermanence of space, etc.,🔽because they exist.”

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas pa 'ga' zhig la 'di ltar 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas pa 'ga' zhig la 'di ltar 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: The non-Buddhist makes the Buddhist accept the following:

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams de kho na nyid du yod do zhes zung shig ces pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams de kho na nyid du yod do zhes zung shig ces pa la /
translated: “Accept that space, etc., exist in reality.”

original: 'dzin du gzhug bya des smras pa /🔽gal te de rnams de kho na nyid du yod na de ltar gyur na /
analyzed: 'dzin du gzhug bya des smras pa / gal te de rnams de kho na nyid du yod na de ltar gyur na /
translated: The one who is made to accept this says,🔽“If they exist in reality, then they are not permanent, like pots, etc.,

original: don dam par yod pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de rnams rtag pa nyid ma yin par ro zhes so //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de rnams rtag pa nyid ma yin par ro zhes so //
translated: because they exist ultimately.”

original: ci ste 'di khas blang ba ma yin na de rnams yod pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'di khas blang ba ma yin na de rnams yod pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If this is not accepted, then they cannot exist.

original: de ltar ni don byed nus pa gang de kho na don dam par yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ni don byed nus pa gang de kho na don dam par yod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, only that which is able to perform a function ultimately exists.

original: rtag pa la don byed pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa la don byed pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But a permanent thing cannot perform a function,

original: rim pa dang cig car nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa dang cig car nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because sequential and simultaneous performance are contradictory.

original: re zhig de rim gyis don byed pa rigs pa ma yin te /🔽'di ga las na ltos pa med pa'i byed pa po ni rang yod pa tsam gyis te /
analyzed: re zhig de rim gyis don byed pa rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ga las na ltos pa med pa'i byed pa po ni rang yod pa tsam gyis te /
translated: First, it is not logical for a permanent thing to perform a function sequentially.

original: sdod par bya bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod par bya bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could it be? A permanent thing is not a creator, because it is not dependent on anything else, and it is not logical for it to remain as it is, just by its own existence.

original: ci ste phyis kyi dus na 'byung ba'i 'bras @134b bu'i ngor de'i nus pa sngar yod pa ma yin no zhes pas de byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste phyis kyi dus na 'byung ba'i 'bras @134b bu'i ngor de'i nus pa sngar yod pa ma yin no zhes pas de byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If you say that the permanent thing does not have the ability to produce an effect that will occur later, and therefore it does not produce it,

original: de ltar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur na /
translated: then that is so.

original: phyis kyang byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir sngar bzhin no //
translated: Later it would not produce it, because there would be no difference from before.

original: lhan cig byed pa nye bar byas nas phyis byed do zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa nye bar byas nas phyis byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it produces it later, after the cooperating conditions have been assembled,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phul du byung bar bsgrub tu med pa ni ltos par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phul du byung bar bsgrub tu med pa ni ltos par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical for a permanent thing to depend on something else, because it cannot be established as something that is superior.

original: cig car don byed ba'ang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car don byed ba'ang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for them to function simultaneously,

original: don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin ni sngar bzhin du phyis kyang mi byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin ni sngar bzhin du phyis kyang mi byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable that a nature which is able to function would not function later, just as before.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du khas len na de rnams kyi rtag pa nyid kyang med do zhes gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du khas len na de rnams kyi rtag pa nyid kyang med do zhes gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that space and so on exist, one must accept that their permanence does not exist.

original: med pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes pa zhar la byung bas cho ga go //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes pa zhar la byung bas cho ga go //
translated: That they do not exist is also not so.🔽This is the conclusion of the digression.

original: lung las pha rol pos mthong ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di gnas so //
analyzed: lung las pha rol pos mthong ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di gnas so //
translated: The opponent’s view that scripture is a means of valid cognition is not established.

original: don smos pa ni don med pa rtog pas sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin ni rtags ma yin no zhes shes pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: don smos pa ni don med pa rtog pas sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin ni rtags ma yin no zhes shes pa'i don du ste /
translated: The point of mentioning the object is for the purpose of understanding that a nature imagined by a non-Buddhist to be an object is not a reason.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang rung ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang rung ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For example, sound is impermanent because of being any of the homogeneous classes,

original: bum pa bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a pot.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid ni sgra la dngos po'i chos nyid du gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid ni sgra la dngos po'i chos nyid du gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the property of the subject is established as a real entity in the sound.

original: 'on kyang smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang las so //
translated: However, it is due to the power of the speaker's desire to express.

original: de ltar ni sgra rtag ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni sgra rtag ste /
translated: In this way, sound is permanent.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is either the property of the subject or the property of the subject's subject,

original: nam mkha' bzhin zhes 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir rtag par mngon par 'dod pa nam mkha' la sogs pa yang ltos par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin zhes 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir rtag par mngon par 'dod pa nam mkha' la sogs pa yang ltos par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: like space, it is accepted. Therefore, even space and so on, which are accepted as permanent, must be dependent.

original: de'i phyir smra ba po'i 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i chos 'di rnams dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa rnams ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po'i 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i chos 'di rnams dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa rnams ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, these phenomena that operate by the mere desire of the speaker do not operate by the power of things.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu rnams las dngos po 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu rnams las dngos po 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And things are not established from such aspects.

original: dngos po gcig ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: One thing cannot have contradictory natures.

original: gang du chos gcig la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid nye ba can der ni de las don 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang du chos gcig la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid nye ba can der ni de las don 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Where the characteristic of engaging one thing is proximate, the meaning is established from that.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig tu don gzhan 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i chos mthun pa nyid mngon par mthong nas /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig tu don gzhan 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i chos mthun pa nyid mngon par mthong nas /
translated: For example, when one sees the similarity of the nature of the mixture of other things,

original: gong bu 'di ni rva can yin te /
analyzed: gong bu 'di ni rva can yin te /
translated: one says, “This lump is horned,

original: ba lang dang ba men dag las gang yang rung ba yin pa nyid yi phyir ro zhes brjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ba lang dang ba men dag las gang yang rung ba yin pa nyid yi phyir ro zhes brjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: because it is either a cow or a buffalo.”

original: 'phros pas chog go //
analyzed: 'phros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: dngos po ma yin pa rtog pas sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin ni rtags ma @135a * //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa rtog pas sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin ni rtags ma @135a * //
translated: The nature that is imputed by thought to a non-thing is not a reason.

original: yin no zhes pa 'di ni gnas so //
analyzed: yin no zhes pa 'di ni gnas so //
translated: This is the point.

original: 'dir yang tshul gang yang rung ba ma brjod pa ni ma tshang ba nyid ces bshad par 'gyur ro zhes slar yang bshad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshul gang yang rung ba ma brjod pa ni ma tshang ba nyid ces bshad par 'gyur ro zhes slar yang bshad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is explained that the failure to state any of the modes is a “deficiency.” But it should not be explained in this way,

original: bstan pa 'di kho nas don gyis brjod zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di kho nas don gyis brjod zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because this very teaching has already implicitly stated the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar tshul gsum pa gtan tshigs yin zhes bshad pas tshul re re ba dang gnyis gnyis pa'i don ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ba de ltar tshul gsum brjod pa gzhan don rjes su dpag pa'o zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar tshul gsum pa gtan tshigs yin zhes bshad pas tshul re re ba dang gnyis gnyis pa'i don ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ba de ltar tshul gsum brjod pa gzhan don rjes su dpag pa'o zhes brjod pas /
translated: In the same way, it is said that the expression of the trimodal condition is the inference for the sake of others.

original: tshul re re dang gnyis gnyis brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshul re re dang gnyis gnyis brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The expression of each of the three modes and the expression of two of the three modes are not inference.

original: 'o na ci zhe na ma tshang ba nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa'i skyon te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na ma tshang ba nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa'i skyon te /
translated: What then? The fault of the incomplete proof.

original: de las pha rol po la yang dag pa'i nges pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las pha rol po la yang dag pa'i nges pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because from that, the opponent does not generate true ascertainment.

original: 'o na gang zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: Now, in response to the question, “What is the inference for the sake of others?”

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa tsam rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa tsam rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that the mere expression of the trimodal reason is the inference for the sake of others.

original: rigs pa phra mo la sogs pa rtog ge'i bstan bcos rnams su phyogs brjod pa yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: rigs pa phra mo la sogs pa rtog ge'i bstan bcos rnams su phyogs brjod pa yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed do //
translated: In the treatises of logic, such as the Fine Points of Logic, the expression of the position is also taught to be the proof. Therefore, it is asked.

original: gzhan don rjes su dpag par bkod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan don rjes su dpag par bkod pa ni /
translated: The following verse is a summary of the chapter on altruism.🔽

original: de'i nang du 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nang du 'dus pa ste /
translated: The arrangement of the inference for the sake of others is included in that,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught as a part of the proof.

original: de ci ltar zhes pa de'i bstan bcos byed pa rnams la de la 'thad pa ci zhig yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar zhes pa de'i bstan bcos byed pa rnams la de la 'thad pa ci zhig yod ces pa'o //
translated: How is that? The treatises on that are for those who say, “What is reasonable in that?”

original: de rnams kho na la dri bar bya'o zhes pa /
analyzed: de rnams kho na la dri bar bya'o zhes pa /
translated: It is intended that they alone should be questioned.

original: gang rnams bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i ngor nus pa med pa'i phyogs kyi tshig kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du smra ba rnams la'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i ngor nus pa med pa'i phyogs kyi tshig kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du smra ba rnams la'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: Those who say that the words of the position, which are not capable of establishing the probandum, are themselves the proof.

original: yang ci ltar phyogs kyi tshig nus pa med pa nyid yin /
analyzed: yang ci ltar phyogs kyi tshig nus pa med pa nyid yin /
translated: Again, how is it that the words of the position are not capable?

original: ji srid du bsgrub par bya brjod par byed pa med na gtan tshigs kyi tshig mi 'jug pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ji srid du bsgrub par bya brjod par byed pa med na gtan tshigs kyi tshig mi 'jug pa kho na ste /
translated: As long as the words of the reason do not engage, because the probandum is not stated,

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug par byed pa'i phyir phyogs kyi tshig la yang nus pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug par byed pa'i phyir phyogs kyi tshig la yang nus pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: therefore, because the words of the reason engage, the words of the position are only capable.

original: gal te de lta na mi mthun phyogs kyi tshig la'ang thal 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mi mthun phyogs kyi tshig la'ang thal 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the words of the discordant side are also a consequence.

original: 'ga' zhig gis sgra rtag go zhes brjod pa na pha rol pos smras pa /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis sgra rtag go zhes brjod pa na pha rol pos smras pa /
translated: When someone says, “Sound is permanent,” the opponent says,

original: sgra byas pa yan la /
analyzed: sgra byas pa yan la /
translated: “Sound is a product.

original: byas pa yang mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa yang mi rtag pa ste /
translated: A product is impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes so //
translated: for example, like a pot.”

original: de ltar mi mthun phyogs kyi tshig las kyang gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir na mi mthun phyogs kyi tshig kyang byas pa nyid rjod pa de dang lhan cig sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun phyogs kyi tshig las kyang gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir na mi mthun phyogs kyi tshig kyang byas pa nyid rjod pa de dang lhan cig sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, because the words of the reason are applied even from the words of the discordant side, the words of the discordant side would also be an affirming reason that expresses “product.”

original: de'i phyir @135b 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir @135b 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore this is illogical.

original: 'o na rtogs su 'jug pa pos ji srid du gtan tshigs kyi yul ma brjod pa de srid du gtan tshigs 'jug pa mi srid pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs su 'jug pa pos ji srid du gtan tshigs kyi yul ma brjod pa de srid du gtan tshigs 'jug pa mi srid pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But until the one who is to be convinced states the object of the reason, is it not the case that it is impossible for the reason to be stated?

original: gdon mi za bar yul bshad par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yul bshad par bya ba yin la /
translated: The object must be explained without doubt.

original: de'i phyir yul ston pa kho na las /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul ston pa kho na las /
translated: Therefore, the object is taught alone.

original: phyogs kyi tshig bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i ngor nus pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshig bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i ngor nus pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: The term “subject” is capable of establishing the thesis.

original: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: phyogs kyi tshig med par yang /🔽gang 'ga' zhig tu byas pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshig med par yang / gang 'ga' zhig tu byas pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Even without the term “subject,”🔽if one states the pervasion and the property of the subject,

original: sgra yang byas pa'o zhes khyab pa dang phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa na /
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa'o zhes khyab pa dang phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa na /
translated: saying “Whatever is produced is impermanent, and sound is produced,”

original: sgra mi rtag pa'o zhes don gyis rtogs pa kho na'o zhes pas phyogs kyi tshig don dang bral pa'o //🔽des na phyogs ni ma brjod na yang 'grub pa la gegs med pa'i phyir tshul gsum po rnams las gang yang rung ba kho na brjod pa ni ma tshang ba nyid rjod pa sgrub par byed pa'i skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'o zhes don gyis rtogs pa kho na'o zhes pas phyogs kyi tshig don dang bral pa'o // des na phyogs ni ma brjod na yang 'grub pa la gegs med pa'i phyir tshul gsum po rnams las gang yang rung ba kho na brjod pa ni ma tshang ba nyid rjod pa sgrub par byed pa'i skyon yin gyi /
translated: then the meaning “Sound is impermanent” is understood implicitly.🔽Therefore, even if the subject is not stated, there is no impediment to establishing the thesis.

original: phyogs ma brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs ma brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, stating any one of the three modes is a fault of the proof statement, but not stating the subject is not.

original: gal te 'o na phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If the term “subject” is not a proof,

original: de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag gi skabs su khyed cag gis kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid nges par bstan pa rigs pa ma yin no zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag gi skabs su khyed cag gis kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid nges par bstan pa rigs pa ma yin no zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: At that time, when the branch of proof is being done, it is not right for you to teach the definition of the inferential object.

original: kho bo cag gi ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Our own is...

original: 'dis bstan par bya ba'o rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa ni rjes su dpag bya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis bstan par bya ba'o rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa ni rjes su dpag bya bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught. The teaching of the inferential object is the teaching of the inferential object.

original: de yang 'dir mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'i dam bca' brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'i dam bca' brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And that should be known here as the teaching of the definition, not as the statement of a thesis.

original: gtan tshigs ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin la don ni gtan tshigs don te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin la don ni gtan tshigs don te /
translated: The reason is the evidence of the three modes. The object is the object of the reason.

original: de gang gi yul yin pa de ni gtan tshigs don gyi yul can no //
analyzed: de gang gi yul yin pa de ni gtan tshigs don gyi yul can no //
translated: That which is the domain of that is the subject of the object of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pas ni gtan tshigs kyi don phyin ci ma log par rab tu gsal ba de'i phyir de'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pas ni gtan tshigs kyi don phyin ci ma log par rab tu gsal ba de'i phyir de'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the definition of the inferential object is taught, the object of the reason is clearly unmistaken. Therefore, because it is the domain of that,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i skabs su'ang de nye bar bkod pa'o zhes pa ngag gi don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i skabs su'ang de nye bar bkod pa'o zhes pa ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is: “Even when the proof is being made, that is set forth.”

original: yan lag rnams su zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag rnams su zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The branches, etc., are as follows:

original: yan lag rnams kyi skabs rnams su gang rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa de ni /
analyzed: yan lag rnams kyi skabs rnams su gang rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa de ni /
translated: In the branches, i.e., in the contexts, whatever is taught as the inferential object,

original: kho bo cag gis sgrub par byed pa nyid du ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sgrub par byed pa nyid du ma yin no //
translated: that is not the proof itself for us.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de kho na la the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na la the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because doubt arises about that very thing.

original: de las zhes pa ni a'arya la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir bdun pa'i don la ta si'o //
analyzed: de las zhes pa ni a'arya la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir bdun pa'i don la ta si'o //
translated: From that, i.e., from the very Ārya, etc., the meaning of the seventh case is the tasi.

original: de kho na la ste rjes su dpag par bya ba la the tshom @136a * //
analyzed: de kho na la ste rjes su dpag par bya ba la the tshom @136a * //
translated: From that very thing, i.e., the inferential object, doubt arises.

original: skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang na rgyu'i lnga pa'i mtha' can kho na las ta si 'di ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i lnga pa'i mtha' can kho na las ta si 'di ste /
translated: Or, this tasi is only from the fifth case ending.

original: de kho na las te rjes su dpag par bya ba dmigs pa'i rgyu las the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na las te rjes su dpag par bya ba dmigs pa'i rgyu las the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: From that very thing, i.e., from the observed cause of the inferential object, doubt arises. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis rjes su dpag par bya ba the tshom can nyid du ston cing don 'di gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dis rjes su dpag par bya ba the tshom can nyid du ston cing don 'di gsal bar byed de /
translated: This shows that the object to be inferred is uncertain, and it clarifies this point.

original: grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin la /
analyzed: grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin la /
translated: It is an establishment of what is already established, not the other.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang the tshom can te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang the tshom can te /
translated: And the object to be inferred is uncertain.

original: de ni re zhig gzhan la'ang 'grub par byed pa'i nus pa med na bdag nyid la lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni re zhig gzhan la'ang 'grub par byed pa'i nus pa med na bdag nyid la lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: For it is not possible for it to establish itself, much less something else.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas de'i tshig kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas de'i tshig kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is shown that the object to be inferred is not an establishment, its words are also shown.

original: de ltar ni don kho na ni dngos su rtogs par byed kyi tshig gis ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ni don kho na ni dngos su rtogs par byed kyi tshig gis ma yin la /
translated: In this way, the meaning is directly understood, not the words.

original: de ni nus pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir brgyud pas sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nus pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir brgyud pas sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is clarified by the meaning of the capacity, it becomes an indirect establishment.

original: gang la don nyid la bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i nus pa med par nges pa de la /
analyzed: gang la don nyid la bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i nus pa med par nges pa de la /
translated: For one who is certain that the meaning itself lacks the capacity to establish what is to be established,

original: da rjod par byed pa la shin tu'ang nus pa med do zhes gsal ba kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: da rjod par byed pa la shin tu'ang nus pa med do zhes gsal ba kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Now, it should be understood that the expression is completely powerless.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pas /🔽gtan tshigs don gyi yul can 'dod //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pas / gtan tshigs don gyi yul can 'dod //
translated: But, etc.

original: ces pa'i don 'chad do //
analyzed: ces pa'i don 'chad do //
translated: The meaning of the statement, “The reason is asserted to have an objective domain” is explained.

original: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi don gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos gzhan du byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi don gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos gzhan du byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, isn’t the definition of the meaning of the reason stated in another treatise on logic?

original: de ci'i phyir 'dir bya zhi na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'dir bya zhi na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it stated here?

original: de ni des gsal bar bya ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni des gsal bar bya ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said, “That is clarified by that.”

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag 'dod pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba de kho na gtan tshigs nges bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag 'dod pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba de kho na gtan tshigs nges bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: Because the reason is to be established only for that which is to be inferred according to our assertion,

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: not for what is imagined by others, therefore its definition is to be stated.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu kho na'i don gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya'i de las bzlog pa ma yin par ci ltar shes par 'gyur zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu kho na'i don gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya'i de las bzlog pa ma yin par ci ltar shes par 'gyur zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is: “How will it be known that only an object of this kind is to be established by the reason, and not the opposite of that?”

original: de'i phyir 'dir mdor bsdus pas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir mdor bsdus pas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught here in brief.

original: mang po rnams la bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can gyi log par rtogs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: mang po rnams la bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can gyi log par rtogs pa mthong ste /
translated: One sees that there are many who are the subjects of the object of refutation,

original: de'i phyir de bsal ba'i don du bstan bcos su phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bstan par byas kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bsal ba'i don du bstan bcos su phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bstan par byas kyi /
translated: and therefore, in order to eliminate that, the treatise teaches the definition of a position,

original: sbyor ba'i dus su de bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus su de bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not to be taught at the time of the syllogism,

original: nye bar mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not necessary.

original: ci ste yang bstan par bya ba'o zhes shin tu 'bad ba de lta na'ang rnam pa 'di lta bu bstan par bya'o zhes slob pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ste yang bstan par bya ba'o zhes shin tu 'bad ba de lta na'ang rnam pa 'di lta bu bstan par bya'o zhes slob pa gsungs pa /
translated: But if it is to be taught, then even if it is taught with great effort, it should be taught in this way.🔽The teacher says:

original: ngo bo kho na @136b zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo kho na @136b zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature itself, etc.

original: 'dir ngo bo dang / tshig phrad dang / 'dod pa dang rang nyid kyi tshig pa zhi mo rnams kyis rim pa ji lta bar ma grub pa dang / sgrub par byed pa min pa dang / 'dod pas yul du byas pa dang / sgrub par byed pa byed pa bos bsgrub par 'dod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ngo bo dang / tshig phrad dang / 'dod pa dang rang nyid kyi tshig pa zhi mo rnams kyis rim pa ji lta bar ma grub pa dang / sgrub par byed pa min pa dang / 'dod pas yul du byas pa dang / sgrub par byed pa byed pa bos bsgrub par 'dod pa gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the four modes of the probandum are respectively understood as nonestablished, nonestablished as a proof, taken as an object by desire, and the means of proof desired to be stated.

original: de las kyang bsgrub par bya ba tshul bzhi pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang bsgrub par bya ba tshul bzhi pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, the four modes of the probandum are taught.

original: grub pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes pa /
analyzed: grub pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes pa /
translated: [The four modes of the proof] are not by the nature of established and means of establishing.

original: rim pa ji lta bar ngo bo dang tshig phrad dag gi rnam par gcad par bya ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar ngo bo dang tshig phrad dag gi rnam par gcad par bya ba ston par byed do //
translated: [The four modes of the proof] are shown to be the four objects of exclusion by the nature and the term, respectively.

original: de ltar ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgras ma grub pa bzung la /
analyzed: de ltar ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgras ma grub pa bzung la /
translated: In that case, the term “own nature” takes nonestablished.

original: de'i rnam par gcad par bya ba ni grub pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par gcad par bya ba ni grub pa ste /
translated: Its object of exclusion is established.

original: sgra mnyan par bya ba'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra mnyan par bya ba'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “sound is to be heard.”

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes pa tshig phrad kyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa gzung la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes pa tshig phrad kyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa gzung la /
translated: The phrase “by its own nature alone” is to be understood as not being established by a copula.

original: de'i rnam bar gcad par bya ba ni ma grub kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam bar gcad par bya ba ni ma grub kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod ba ste /
translated: And its exclusion is asserted to be the very establishment.

original: dper na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dbe dag ste /
analyzed: dper na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dbe dag ste /
translated: For example, a nonestablished reason and example,

original: sgra rtag ste mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir blo bzhin zhes pa 'di lta bu'i ngo bo dag go //
analyzed: sgra rtag ste mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir blo bzhin zhes pa 'di lta bu'i ngo bo dag go //
translated: like this: “Sound is permanent because of being perceptible by the eye, like the intellect.”

original: de la grub zin rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can go sla ba nyid kyi phyir sgrub par byed pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can kho na de lta na yang zhes pa la sogs pas ston par byed do//
analyzed: de la grub zin rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can go sla ba nyid kyi phyir sgrub par byed pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can kho na de lta na yang zhes pa la sogs pas ston par byed do//
translated: Regarding that, the one that has the effect of excluding what is already established is easier to understand, so the one that has the effect of excluding the establishment is taught by “even though” and so on.

original: de lta na yang zhes pa nges par gzung ba la ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes pa nges par gzung ba la ste /
translated: “Even though” is a restriction.

original: yod na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yod na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means “if it exists.”

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe ltar snang ba yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe ltar snang ba yang de dag yin la /
translated: Those are the apparent reasons and examples,

original: ma grub pa dag kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa dag kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: and they are also the nonestablished ones.

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ltar snang ba dag brjod pa yongs su spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ltar snang ba dag brjod pa yongs su spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: The expression of a reason and example that are not established would be completely abandoned.

original: dam bca' ba nyid dor bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dam bca' ba nyid dor bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the thesis itself would be abandoned.

original: 'o na gang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe yin pa de dag de ltar snang ba nyid la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ltar snang ba smos pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe yin pa de dag de ltar snang ba nyid la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ltar snang ba smos pa don med do zhe na /
translated: But if the reason and example are not established, then it is pointless to mention the seeming because they are not mistaken with respect to just that appearance.

original: gal te khyad par rtsom par spyi brjod par 'dod ba na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par rtsom par spyi brjod par 'dod ba na /
translated: If one wishes to express the general after beginning the particular,

original: khyad par mngon par brjod pa na sngon du 'gro ba don med do zhes pas /
analyzed: khyad par mngon par brjod pa na sngon du 'gro ba don med do zhes pas /
translated: then it is pointless for the particular to be stated first.

original: spyi mngon par brjod pa na /
analyzed: spyi mngon par brjod pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the general is stated,

original: khyad par spyi la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir spyi'i sgra sbyor ba don med do //
analyzed: khyad par spyi la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir spyi'i sgra sbyor ba don med do //
translated: it is pointless to apply the term “general” because the particular is not mistaken with respect to the general.

original: spyi rtsom pa na khyad par mngon par brjod pa na ni /
analyzed: spyi rtsom pa na khyad par mngon par brjod pa na ni /
translated: When the general is begun,

original: spyi khyad par la 'khrul pa'i phyir rnam gcod la ltos so zhes pas khyad par gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i ched du khyad @137a * //
analyzed: spyi khyad par la 'khrul pa'i phyir rnam gcod la ltos so zhes pas khyad par gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i ched du khyad @137a * //
translated: then because the general is mistaken with respect to the particular, it depends on exclusion. Therefore, in order to exclude other particulars, the particular is stated.

original: bar gyi sgra rab tu sbyor ba ni don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar gyi sgra rab tu sbyor ba ni don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The intermediate sound is used in a meaningful way.

original: 'dir yang gtan tshigs dang dpe ltar snang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gang spyi de /
analyzed: 'dir yang gtan tshigs dang dpe ltar snang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gang spyi de /
translated: Here, the reason and example are the characteristics of the mere general.

original: de'i skabs kyi ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par brjod par 'dod do zhes pas don med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i skabs kyi ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par brjod par 'dod do zhes pas don med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is to be expressed is the particular that has the characteristic of non-establishment in that context. Thus, it is not meaningless.

original: gal te spyi nye bar rtsom pa la khyad par brjod par 'dod pa na spyi'i sgra sngon du sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi nye bar rtsom pa la khyad par brjod par 'dod pa na spyi'i sgra sngon du sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the general is to be expressed first when beginning, the word general would be used first.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽

original: 'grel par rim pa bstan bcos kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grel par rim pa bstan bcos kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the order is made by the treatise.

original: ngag la ni sgra rnams brjod par 'dod pa rjes su sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: ngag la ni sgra rnams brjod par 'dod pa rjes su sgrub par byed la /
translated: In speech, the sounds are used to accomplish what is to be expressed.

original: tshig sdud pa nye bar bsgyur ba'i rjes su sngon ma'o zhes pa'i bstan bcos kyis snga ma dang phyi ma nyid nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig sdud pa nye bar bsgyur ba'i rjes su sngon ma'o zhes pa'i bstan bcos kyis snga ma dang phyi ma nyid nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The treatise says that the former is after the affix and the latter is after the compounding word. Thus, the former and latter are ascertained.

original: gal te yang spyi nye bar rtsom pa la khyad par brjod par 'dod pa de lta na'ang khyad par gyi sgra kho na sngon du sbyor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang spyi nye bar rtsom pa la khyad par brjod par 'dod pa de lta na'ang khyad par gyi sgra kho na sngon du sbyor bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even if one does want to state a particular in the context of a general statement, the word for the particular would be used first.

original: de ltar gyur na spyi'i sgra mi sbyor bar thal ba yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na spyi'i sgra mi sbyor bar thal ba yang med do //
translated: And if that were the case, there would be no entailment that the word for the general would not be used.

original: thams cad tshig gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshig gi cha shas 'ba' zhig ba rab tu sbyar bar 'os pa yang ma yin te rang bzhin dang rkyen bzhin no zhes pa 'phros pas chog go //
analyzed: thams cad tshig gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshig gi cha shas 'ba' zhig ba rab tu sbyar bar 'os pa yang ma yin te rang bzhin dang rkyen bzhin no zhes pa 'phros pas chog go //
translated: And it is not the case that only the parts of the sentence are fit to be used, because all of them are the same word, like the word “nature” and the word “condition.”🔽Enough with the digression.

original: de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul gyis bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul gyis bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: It is not the case that they are to be taught by way of proving them,

original: ma grub pa dag kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa dag kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is evident that they are the very means of proof of what is not established.

original: 'o na 'dir rgol ba rang nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa de bsgrub bya yin la /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir rgol ba rang nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa de bsgrub bya yin la /
translated: Well, then, here, what is to be proven is what the opponent himself asserts as the probandum.

original: ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni de'i tshe des bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'ang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni de'i tshe des bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'ang ma yin gyi /
translated: The proof of what is not established is not asserted to be the probandum at that time,

original: 'dod par 'gyur ba yin mod /
analyzed: 'dod par 'gyur ba yin mod /
translated: but it is asserted to be the probandum.

original: de las nishtha'i rkyen ni byung ba'i dus la nges pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de las nishtha'i rkyen ni byung ba'i dus la nges pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the time of the occurrence of the condition of the suffix is definite,

original: rang nyid 'dod pa brjod pas nges par gzung ba'i don rtogs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang nyid 'dod pa brjod pas nges par gzung ba'i don rtogs pa kho na ste /
translated: only the meaning of the definite object expressed by the assertion of the self is understood.

original: de'i phyir kho na'i sgra don med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho na'i sgra don med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore the word eva has no meaning.

original: gal te byung ba'i dus kho na la 'dod pa'i sgra 'jug par 'thob na de de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te byung ba'i dus kho na la 'dod pa'i sgra 'jug par 'thob na de de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is obtained that the word eva applies only at the time of occurrence, then that would be the case.

original: de ni 'thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'thob pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not obtained.

original: dus gsum gyi yul can bya ba'i mtha' can dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi yul can bya ba'i mtha' can dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is related to the suffix of action that has an object in the three times.

original: dper na lhas byin blta bar bya ba 'ongs so zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin blta bar bya ba 'ongs so zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like “Devadatta, the object of seeing, has come.”

original: de'i phyir 'dir aishu'i nishtha 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir aishu'i nishtha 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore here eva does not have the meaning of having an effect.

original: de'i phyir ma grub pa'i rtags la sogs pa brjod par gyur pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma grub pa'i rtags la sogs pa brjod par gyur pa la /
translated: Therefore, when the sign and so on of what is not established are expressed,

original: pha rol gyis skyon brjod pa na /
analyzed: pha rol gyis skyon brjod pa na /
translated: When the opponent makes an objection,

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan par bya ba nyid kyang srid do zhes @137b pas ston par 'gyur ba'ang phyogs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan par bya ba nyid kyang srid do zhes @137b pas ston par 'gyur ba'ang phyogs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it is possible that it is the very thing to be established, and so it is also possible that it is the very proof.

original: de'i phyir de bzlog pa'i ched du tshig phrad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzlog pa'i ched du tshig phrad brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, the author of the commentary states the following.

original: bstan bcos la mi ltos par zhes pa ni bstan bcos la ltos pa med par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos la mi ltos par zhes pa ni bstan bcos la ltos pa med par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Not relying on a treatise means not relying on a treatise.

original: bas blangs pa zhes pa ni dam bca' ba'i don to //
analyzed: bas blangs pa zhes pa ni dam bca' ba'i don to //
translated: What is accepted means the meaning of the thesis.

original: de khas blang bar bya ba'o zhes pas khas blang ba'o //
analyzed: de khas blang bar bya ba'o zhes pas khas blang ba'o //
translated: That is to be accepted means accepting it.

original: 'o na rang nyid 'dod pa zhes pa 'dis rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes rtogs par byed pas gzhan 'dod pa thams cad rnam par gcod par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na rang nyid 'dod pa zhes pa 'dis rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes rtogs par byed pas gzhan 'dod pa thams cad rnam par gcod par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But then, since this “what is accepted by oneself” makes it understood that only what is accepted by the proponent himself is to be established, doesn’t it exclude all that is accepted by others?

original: de'i phyir rang nyid 'dod pa zhes pa 'dis gzhan 'dod pa thams cad la mi ltos par khas blangs pa ston par byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid 'dod pa zhes pa 'dis gzhan 'dod pa thams cad la mi ltos par khas blangs pa ston par byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya mod /
translated: Therefore, you should say that the phrase “that which is asserted by oneself” indicates that the assertion does not rely on the assertions of others.

original: rang nyid 'dod pa zhes pa 'dis bstan bcos la mi ltos par khas blangs pa ston par byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya ba de skad du smra ba de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid 'dod pa zhes pa 'dis bstan bcos la mi ltos par khas blangs pa ston par byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya ba de skad du smra ba de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase “that which is asserted by oneself” that you say indicates that the assertion does not rely on the treatise?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'dir bstan bcos khas blangs pa na yang /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos khas blangs pa na yang /
translated: When one asserts a treatise,🔽if one asserts many qualities of space, such as being the substratum of form,

original: gal te mang bstan bcos de phyed pa pos chos can gcig la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa mang po rnams mngon par 'dod pa de lta na'ang /
analyzed: gal te mang bstan bcos de phyed pa pos chos can gcig la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa mang po rnams mngon par 'dod pa de lta na'ang /
translated: then one must assert the treatise that explains those qualities.

original: sgrub par byed pa 'god par byed pa po bdag nyid kho nas gang sgrub par 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rang nyid smos par byas
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'god par byed pa po bdag nyid kho nas gang sgrub par 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rang nyid smos par byas
translated: The one who is the author of the treatise, the one who establishes the treatise, himself establishes only that phenomenon which he wishes to establish, such as impermanence, and not the other.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he states “I” in the root text.

original: so // de'i phyir des gzhan 'dod pa thams cad sel na'ang dogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa de tsam sel ba la de'i bya ba bstan pa'i ched du 'di skad bshad do //
analyzed: so // de'i phyir des gzhan 'dod pa thams cad sel na'ang dogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa de tsam sel ba la de'i bya ba bstan pa'i ched du 'di skad bshad do //
translated: Therefore, although he refutes all the assertions of others, he states this in order to demonstrate that he refutes only the point that is the basis of doubt.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir der mthong ba thams cad bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes dogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir der mthong ba thams cad bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes dogs par 'gyur la /
translated: One might think that because he accepts the treatise, everything that appears in it is to be established.

original: 'ga' zhig rnams kyis bstan bcos su mthong ba ni bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnams kyis bstan bcos su mthong ba ni bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba kho na yin la /
translated: Some think that whatever appears in a treatise is to be established.

original: de la gnod na'ang gtan tshigs dang dam bca' dag gi skyon yin no zhes log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba kho na ste de rnams kyi sgra la byas pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba na /
analyzed: de la gnod na'ang gtan tshigs dang dam bca' dag gi skyon yin no zhes log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba kho na ste de rnams kyi sgra la byas pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba na /
translated: When sound is established as impermanent,

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i chos sel ba na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i chos sel ba na /
translated: the quality of space, etc., are eliminated.

original: ji ltar 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar dri la sa'i yon tan nyid sel ba na'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar dri la sa'i yon tan nyid sel ba na'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is contradictory, in the same way, when smell is eliminated, the quality of earth is eliminated.

original: de ltar yin mod kyi dri sa'i yon tan nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin mod kyi dri sa'i yon tan nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i skabs ma yin te /
translated: Even though that is so, the quality of earth of smell is not the occasion for the probandum.

original: @138a * // des na de sel na yang 'gal ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @138a * // des na de sel na yang 'gal ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even if it is eliminated, it is not contradictory.

original: de ni gzhan la mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni gzhan la mtshungs te /
translated: That is similar to the other.

original: gang phyir ji ltar dri la sa'i yon tan nyid skabs ma yin pa de ltar sgra la yang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang phyir ji ltar dri la sa'i yon tan nyid skabs ma yin pa de ltar sgra la yang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Just as the quality of earth of smell is not the occasion, in the same way, the quality of space of sound, etc., are not the occasion.

original: de'i phyir de la gnod na'ang skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gnod na'ang skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if it is damaged, it is not a fault.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa la chos can sgra skabs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa la chos can sgra skabs yin te /
translated: Indeed, that is so, but the subject is the quality of space, etc.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid dam bca' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid dam bca' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because impermanence is the thesis.

original: de'i phyir de nyid bzlog pa la skyon yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid bzlog pa la skyon yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reversal of that is the fault.

original: sa'i yon tan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa'i yon tan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But the quality of earth is not,

original: de chos can gyi skabs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de chos can gyi skabs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not the subject.

original: 'di ni lan rigs pa ma yin te /🔽gang phyir gang las sa'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa na 'gyur ba ma yin pa rgol bas nye bar bkod pa'i chos can gyi skabs ma yin no zhes pas /
analyzed: 'di ni lan rigs pa ma yin te / gang phyir gang las sa'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa na 'gyur ba ma yin pa rgol bas nye bar bkod pa'i chos can gyi skabs ma yin no zhes pas /
translated: This is not a proper response.🔽Because the quality of earth is not reversed from what the opponent has stated as the subject,

original: chos can la brten pas nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa na skyon du brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos can la brten pas nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa na skyon du brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: the reversal of the quality of space is not said to be a fault in terms of the subject.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bstan bcos kyi don sgrub par byed pa skabs yin no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don sgrub par byed pa skabs yin no zhes byas nas so //
translated: The subject is the treatise’s meaning to be proven.

original: des na gal te yang chos can skabs ma yin pa de ltan yang bstan bcos kyi don sgrub par byed pa skabs yin no zhes pas /
analyzed: des na gal te yang chos can skabs ma yin pa de ltan yang bstan bcos kyi don sgrub par byed pa skabs yin no zhes pas /
translated: Therefore, even if the subject is not the occasion, still, since the meaning of the treatise is being established, it is the occasion.

original: bstan bcos su nye bar blangs pa'i chos gcig la'ang 'ga' zhig gis sel ba na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang dam bca' dag gi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos su nye bar blangs pa'i chos gcig la'ang 'ga' zhig gis sel ba na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang dam bca' dag gi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: When someone refutes even a single phenomenon that is mentioned in the treatise, since it would be a refutation of the property to be established, it would be a fault of the reason and thesis.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos su mthong ba thams cad bsgrub par bya ba yin la de la gnod na yang gtan tshigs dang dam bca' dag gi skyon yin no zhes pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos su mthong ba thams cad bsgrub par bya ba yin la de la gnod na yang gtan tshigs dang dam bca' dag gi skyon yin no zhes pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that everything that is mentioned in the treatise is to be established and that if it is refuted, it is a fault of the reason and thesis.

original: gang rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa de kho na rigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa de kho na rigs pa'o //
translated: It is logical that only that which the proponent himself asserts to be the property to be established is to be established.

original: 'di ni song ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni song ngo //
translated: This is where we are going.

original: 'o na 'dod pa smos pa ci'i don yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod pa smos pa ci'i don yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the point of mentioning “desired”?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We say this:

original: ma brjod pa ni 'dod pas yul du byas kyang bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: ma brjod pa ni 'dod pas yul du byas kyang bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin la /
translated: That which is not mentioned is not the object of desire and is not to be established.

original: des na de'i sgo nas skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod do zhes kha cig la log par rtogs pa 'di yod de /
analyzed: des na de'i sgo nas skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod do zhes kha cig la log par rtogs pa 'di yod de /
translated: Therefore, some think that the fault of the reductio is similar to the fault of an increase in the reductio, and that the reductio is not stated in order to avoid this fault.

original: de'i phyir de sel ba'i ched du ma brjod kyang 'dod pas yul du byas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de sel ba'i ched du ma brjod kyang 'dod pas yul du byas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: But this is not the case, for although it is not stated, the pervasion is established by the opponent’s assertion.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyi don yin zhes pa 'dir mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyi don nyid du bsgrub par bya ba na /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyi don yin zhes pa 'dir mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyi don nyid du bsgrub par bya ba na /
translated: For example, in the case of the argument “The eye and so on are for the sake of another,” the eye and so on are established as being for the sake of another.

original: ma brjod kyang 'dod pas khyab pa @138b bdag gi don nyid bsgrub bya yin pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ma brjod kyang 'dod pas khyab pa @138b bdag gi don nyid bsgrub bya yin pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Although it is not stated, the pervasion is established by the opponent’s assertion, just as in the case of the syllogism “The eye and so on are for the sake of the self.”

original: gal te rgol ba'i 'dod pas bsgrub bya yin pa de'i tshe chos kyi khyad par zlog pa sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa mi srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te rgol ba'i 'dod pas bsgrub bya yin pa de'i tshe chos kyi khyad par zlog pa sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa mi srid pa kho na ste /
translated: If the pervasion is established by the opponent’s assertion, then it is impossible to state a syllogism that has a contradictory predicate.

original: bsgrub par bya ba tshogs pa ni gcig kho na yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba tshogs pa ni gcig kho na yin la /
translated: This is because the totality of the object of the probandum is only one.

original: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa'ang gcig kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa'ang gcig kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the opposite of that is also one alone.

original: 'di bden te /
analyzed: 'di bden te /
translated: This is true.

original: gang tshogs pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa gcig pu kho na 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: gang tshogs pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa gcig pu kho na 'gal ba ste /
translated: The opposite of the collection is the one that is the opposite of the collection, and it is the opposite of the collection alone that is the probandum.

original: tshogs pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de ni res 'ga' chos can gyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: tshogs pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de ni res 'ga' chos can gyi sgo nas sam /
translated: That is because the collection alone is the probandum.🔽That is sometimes done by way of the subject,

original: chos kyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo nas sam /
translated: sometimes by way of the predicate,

original: de gnyis ka'i sgo nas sam /🔽de'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bya ba'o zhes pas des tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i sgo nas sam / de'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bya ba'o zhes pas des tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: sometimes by way of both of those,🔽and sometimes by way of a distinction of those.

original: rnam par gzhag pa tsam tha dad kyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa tsam tha dad kyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference is merely a matter of terminology, but not a matter of fact.

original: yang ji ltar ma brjod pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar ma brjod pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: Also, how is it understood that the unstated is the probandum?

original: rtsod pa'i skabs las ma brjod pa'ang rtogs so zhes pas 'di ni brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i skabs las ma brjod pa'ang rtogs so zhes pas 'di ni brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is understood that the unstated is the probandum in the context of debate.

original: de'i phyir ma brjod kyang 'dod pas khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brjod kyang 'dod pas khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, even though it is not stated, it is the probandum because it is pervaded by the desire to prove it.

original: de rjes su 'gro ba med na bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dpe la sogs pa'i skyon rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su 'gro ba med na bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dpe la sogs pa'i skyon rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: If there is no subsequent going, then the faults of the example, etc., are the lack of possession of the probandum, etc.

original: ma bsal ba zhes pa la sogs ba ste /
analyzed: ma bsal ba zhes pa la sogs ba ste /
translated: Not refuted, etc.

original: mngon sum yang 'di yin la don yang yin pas mngon sum don no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang 'di yin la don yang yin pas mngon sum don no //
translated: It is perception and it is an object, thus it is a perception object.

original: de dang rjes dpag dang yid ches pa dang grags pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba byas nas zlas dbye gcig dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: de dang rjes dpag dang yid ches pa dang grags pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba byas nas zlas dbye gcig dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de ltar bstan to //
translated: It is that, and it is inference, and it is credible testimony, and it is popular convention, thus it is a perception object, etc. Having made the compound, it is taught in that way, since it is like a single dyad.🔽 On its own subject, etc.

original: rang gi chos can la'o zhes pa 'di rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi chos can la'o zhes pa 'di rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
translated: This is the seventh reason.

original: rang gi chos can yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ma bsal ba'o zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: rang gi chos can yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ma bsal ba'o zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is: not refuted by reason of its being its own subject.

original: /'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: /'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is explained:

original: rang gi chos can la gnod pa nag la te de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa gnod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la'ang 'gyur ba ma yin na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi chos can la gnod pa nag la te de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa gnod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la'ang 'gyur ba ma yin na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If there is no refutation on its own subject, then the refutation that comes from that is not a refutation of the property of the probandum.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa 'di yin na mngon sum la sogs pas rab tu grub pa'i 'gal ba chos gzhan gyi rten bstan pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa 'di yin na mngon sum la sogs pas rab tu grub pa'i 'gal ba chos gzhan gyi rten bstan pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If this seventh reason is the case, then it would be the case that the basis of another property that is clearly established by direct perception and so on is taught.

original: de las kyang khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir chos can gzhan la'ang rab tu grub pas sel bar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de las kyang khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir chos can gzhan la'ang rab tu grub pas sel bar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since it is also said to be without distinction, it would be understood that the exclusion is established with respect to another subject.

original: ma yin te chos can gzhan la rab tu grub pas sel ba mi srid pa'i phyir de kho na la rab tu grub pas zhes par rtogs @139a * //
analyzed: ma yin te chos can gzhan la rab tu grub pas sel ba mi srid pa'i phyir de kho na la rab tu grub pas zhes par rtogs @139a * //
translated: That is not so, because it is impossible that the exclusion is established with respect to another subject. Therefore, it should be understood that it is clearly established with respect to that very subject.

original: par bya'o zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault.

original: rang gi chos 'di la yod pas na rang gi chos can te /
analyzed: rang gi chos 'di la yod pas na rang gi chos can te /
translated: Since this is the property of itself, it is its own subject.

original: rang gi chos can de la'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos can de la'o //
translated: It is with respect to that subject.

original: sgrub byed 'god pa pos bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa ni rang gi chos te de dang ldan pa la'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub byed 'god pa pos bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa ni rang gi chos te de dang ldan pa la'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which the proponent of the proof asserts as the predicate is its property. It is with respect to that which possesses that property.

original: gzhan du na gang gis de'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du 'di 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ba skabs su bab pa ma yin ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can gzhan la skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid kyis gnod pa na
analyzed: gzhan du na gang gis de'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du 'di 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ba skabs su bab pa ma yin ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can gzhan la skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid kyis gnod pa na
translated: Otherwise, it would be a fault to apply to another subject that possesses a property that is not relevant to the context, by the property that it possesses, in order to eliminate the qualm that it possesses that property.

original: skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la ci zhig gnod /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la ci zhig gnod /
translated: But what fault is there in applying to the subject that is relevant to the context?

original: de'i phyir skabs su bab pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can la gnod na skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir skabs su bab pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can la gnod na skyon yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is a fault to apply to the subject that possesses the property that is relevant to the context.🔽But it is not a fault to apply to the subject that possesses the property that is not relevant to the context.

original: skabs su ma bab pa'i chos dang ldan pa lam yin no zhes rtogs pa'i don du rang gi chos can la zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skabs su ma bab pa'i chos dang ldan pa lam yin no zhes rtogs pa'i don du rang gi chos can la zhes brjod do //
translated: In order to understand this, the phrase “to its own subject” is stated.

original: gal te 'di'i don du bya ba ma yin te /🔽rang nyid ces pa 'di kho nas don 'di thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di'i don du bya ba ma yin te / rang nyid ces pa 'di kho nas don 'di thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If this is not the meaning,🔽then the phrase “to its own” alone would convey this meaning.

original: de ltar ni rgol ba rang nyid kyi sgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa de bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni rgol ba rang nyid kyi sgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa de bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is as follows: Whatever is to be established by the proponent himself is the subject.

original: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa /
translated: Therefore, the opposite of that is the counter-subject.

original: sgrub par byed pa kho na la gnod do zhes pa 'di don gyis grub po zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa kho na la gnod do zhes pa 'di don gyis grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established by the meaning,

original: bden te / de ltar don gyis grub na'ang /
analyzed: bden te / de ltar don gyis grub na'ang /
translated: then it is true that it is established by the meaning.

original: 'dir rang gi chos can gyi tshig slar yang byas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi chos can gyi tshig slar yang byas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: But here, the reason for stating the subject again is

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la dngos su gnod na skyon du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la dngos su gnod na skyon du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
