translated: not only to show that if the subject is directly contradicted, then there is a fault.

original: 'on kyang chos can la'ang gnod na ci zhig ltar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don 'di rab tu 'grub pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos can la'ang gnod na ci zhig ltar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don 'di rab tu 'grub pa'i ched du'o //
translated: But rather, it is to establish the point that if the subject is contradicted, then what will happen?

original: gzhan du na ni chos can la gnod na'ang /🔽de'i chos la gnod par 'grub par bya ba'i don du rang gi chos can gyi tshig gal te bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni chos can la gnod na'ang / de'i chos la gnod par 'grub par bya ba'i don du rang gi chos can gyi tshig gal te bya ba ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise, if the subject is contradicted,🔽then if the words of the subject are not used in order to establish that the predicate is contradicted,

original: de'i tshe rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bor 'dod pa'i chos ni bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bor 'dod pa'i chos ni bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, the opponent would not state the subject, because he would not state the subject that he himself accepts as the nature of the thesis.

original: de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa kho na la gnod par rtogs pa pos sems kyi /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa kho na la gnod par rtogs pa pos sems kyi /
translated: The one who understands the damage is only the one who comes through the subject.

original: chos can gyi sgo nas 'ongs pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can gyi sgo nas 'ongs pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the one who comes through the subject itself.

original: de'i phyir rang gi chos can gyi tshig byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi chos can gyi tshig byas so //
translated: Therefore, the words “his own subject” are stated.

original: 'on 'di 'ang don gyis grub pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on 'di 'ang don gyis grub pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t this also established by the meaning itself?

original: de lta ni chos la gnod pas ni de tsam du nyams pa yin la /🔽de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la dngos su gnod pa na 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ni chos la gnod pas ni de tsam du nyams pa yin la / de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la dngos su gnod pa na 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In that case, the subject is damaged to that extent by the damage to the property.🔽Moreover, when the property to be established is directly damaged, it becomes damaged.

original: chos can la gnod pa'i sgo nas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: chos can la gnod pa'i sgo nas kyang rung ste /
translated: Or, it is also suitable that it is damaged through the damage to the subject.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka ltar na yang chos @139b la gnod de /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka ltar na yang chos @139b la gnod de /
translated: In both cases, the property is damaged.

original: de'i phyir chos can la gnod pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pas kyang chos la gnod pa don gyis 'thob pa kho na'o zhes pas de'i don du rang gi chos can la zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can la gnod pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pas kyang chos la gnod pa don gyis 'thob pa kho na'o zhes pas de'i don du rang gi chos can la zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even when it comes through the damage to the subject, the damage to the property is obtained by the meaning itself. Thus, it is not necessary to state “his own subject” for that purpose.

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true.

original: gang du chos can la gnod pa na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnod pa med cing /
analyzed: gang du chos can la gnod pa na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnod pa med cing /
translated: When the subject is refuted, the predicate to be proven is not refuted.🔽When the subject is refuted in a certain domain, the predicate to be proven is not damaged in the least.

original: yul gang zhig la chos can nye bar 'gog pa na yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la nyams pa ci yang med ba de la'ang chos can 'ba' zhig nye bar 'gog pa na'ang rgol ba 'ga' zhig dam bca'i skyon gyis dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon🔽dang ldan pa nyid du 'dod de /🔽dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gang zhig la chos can nye bar 'gog pa na yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la nyams pa ci yang med ba de la'ang chos can 'ba' zhig nye bar 'gog pa na'ang rgol ba 'ga' zhig dam bca'i skyon gyis dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon dang ldan pa nyid du 'dod de / dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: When the subject alone is refuted, some opponents maintain that there is a fault in the thesis and that there is a fault in the reason.🔽For example, space and so on are not of the nature of one because they do not simultaneously produce effects.

original: cig car 'bras bu mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes dngos por gyur pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa chos can yin nam /
analyzed: cig car 'bras bu mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes dngos por gyur pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa chos can yin nam /
translated: Is space and so on, which are things, the subject?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes brjod par 'dod pa khas blangs pa med par /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes brjod par 'dod pa khas blangs pa med par /
translated: Or is it not? Without accepting what is asserted,

original: nam mkha' med pa nyid du smra bas spyir nam mkha' la sogs pa'i phyogs su byas pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' med pa nyid du smra bas spyir nam mkha' la sogs pa'i phyogs su byas pa la /
translated: the one who advocates the nonexistence of space and so on in general makes space and so on into a position.

original: chos kyang rnam par gcod pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam par gcod pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: And with respect to the probandum, which is the mere exclusion of a phenomenon,

original: rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo gtan tshigs yin pa na /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo gtan tshigs yin pa na /
translated: the reason is the nature of the exclusion.🔽When the debater says that the subject, such as space, is not an entity,

original: sun 'byin par byed pa pos dngos por gyur pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can med pa'ang sgrub par byed do zhes smra ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa pos dngos por gyur pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can med pa'ang sgrub par byed do zhes smra ba lta bu ste /
translated: he is proving the nonexistence of an entity.

original: de ltar dngos por gyur pa'i chos can bsal ba na'ang 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos rnam par gcod pa tsam la gnod par 'gyur pa'am rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo'i gtan tshigs kyis ma grub pa nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dngos por gyur pa'i chos can bsal ba na'ang 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos rnam par gcod pa tsam la gnod par 'gyur pa'am rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo'i gtan tshigs kyis ma grub pa nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, even when the entity that is the subject is eliminated, there is no fault in the mere exclusion of the phenomenon that is the probandum. Nor is there any fault in the reason, which is the nature of the exclusion.

original: de lta na yang 'di ltar chos can 'ba' zhig la nye bar gnod na'ang 'dir gnod par kha cig 'dod mod /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ltar chos can 'ba' zhig la nye bar gnod na'ang 'dir gnod par kha cig 'dod mod /
translated: Some people assert that even when the subject alone is undermined, there is a fault.

original: 'dod par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not something to be accepted.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i chos can bsal na'ang /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i chos can bsal na'ang /
translated: Even when the entity that is the subject is eliminated,

original: rnam par gcod pa tsam gyi bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na gang du chos can la gnod pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nye bar 'gog par 'gyur ba der skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa tsam gyi bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs 'grub pa'i phyir ro // des na gang du chos can la gnod pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nye bar 'gog par 'gyur ba der skyon yin gyi /
translated: Because the probandum and the logical reason are established as mere exclusions.🔽Therefore, where the probandum is negated by the negation of the subject, there is a fault.

original: gang du chos can 'gog na'ang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la nyams pa 'ga' yang med pa de la ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du chos can 'gog na'ang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la nyams pa 'ga' yang med pa de la ma yin no //
translated: But where the subject is negated, and yet there is no deficiency in the probandum, there is no fault.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa can gyi chos can kho na bsgrub par @140a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa can gyi chos can kho na bsgrub par @140a * //
translated: Why is this?

original: bya ba yin gyi 'ba' zhig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba yin gyi 'ba' zhig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum is to be established only with respect to a subject that is qualified by one’s own probandum, and not by itself alone.

original: des na 'ba' zhig pa bkag na'ang ci ltar gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na 'ba' zhig pa bkag na'ang ci ltar gnod par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, even if the subject alone is negated, how can there be a fault?

original: de'i phyir rnam par gcod pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba la dngos por gyur ba'i chos can sems na yang skyon dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa 'di rang gi chos can smos pas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gcod pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba la dngos por gyur ba'i chos can sems na yang skyon dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa 'di rang gi chos can smos pas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, even if the subject is a real entity, there is no fault in establishing the probandum as mere exclusion. This is shown by the statement of one’s own subject.

original: 'o na 'di yang rang nyid smos pa kho nas 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'di yang rang nyid smos pa kho nas 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t this also established by the mere mention of it?

original: dngos por gyur pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is asserted that the subject that is an entity is the predicate.

original: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case.

original: dngos por gyur pa dang dngos bor ma gyur pa nyid brjod bar 'dod pa med par /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa dang dngos bor ma gyur pa nyid brjod bar 'dod pa med par /
translated: Because, without expressing the desire to express an entity or a non-entity,

original: spyir brjod par 'dod pas 'dir nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs su byas la /
analyzed: spyir brjod par 'dod pas 'dir nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs su byas la /
translated: the desire to express in general is expressed here, taking space, etc., as the subject.

original: de'i phyir dngos por ma gyur ba dang dngos por gyur pa'i chos can thams cad 'phangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos por ma gyur ba dang dngos por gyur pa'i chos can thams cad 'phangs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, all subjects that are not entities and all subjects that are entities are only implied.

original: de lta na'ang dngos por gyur pa bsal na'ang skyon med de /
analyzed: de lta na'ang dngos por gyur pa bsal na'ang skyon med de /
translated: Even so, there is no fault in excluding the entity,

original: dngos por ma gyur pa'i chos can ma bsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por ma gyur pa'i chos can ma bsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the subject that is not an entity is not excluded.

original: yang gal te dngos por ma gyur pa'i chos can yang bsal na skyon du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: yang gal te dngos por ma gyur pa'i chos can yang bsal na skyon du 'gyur mod /
translated: If the subject that is not an entity is also excluded, there would be a fault.

original: de ni bsal ba ma yin no zhes pas kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: de ni bsal ba ma yin no zhes pas kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: But it is not excluded, so there is no fault.

original: des na 'dir phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'dir rang nyid kyi sgras skabs su bab pa yin pa'i chos gzhan bstan bcos la mthong ba rnams la gang gnod pa de ni 'gal ba ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bshad cing /
analyzed: des na 'dir phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'dir rang nyid kyi sgras skabs su bab pa yin pa'i chos gzhan bstan bcos la mthong ba rnams la gang gnod pa de ni 'gal ba ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bshad cing /
translated: Therefore, here the definition of a position is this: Whatever is seen in the treatise to be a property that is the case in the context of the term “itself” is not a contradiction at all.

original: rang gi chos can la'o zhes pa 'dis ni chos can gzhan bsal ba gang des bsal ba ma yin no zhes bshad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos can la'o zhes pa 'dis ni chos can gzhan bsal ba gang des bsal ba ma yin no zhes bshad do zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase “with respect to its subject” indicates that whatever is not eliminated by that which is eliminated is not eliminated.

original: chos can gang chos kyis khyad par du byas pa zhes pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa kho na'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ston cing /
analyzed: chos can gang chos kyis khyad par du byas pa zhes pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa kho na'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ston cing /
translated: The phrase “the subject that is distinguished by the property” indicates that only a subject that is distinguished by the property to be proven is to be proven.

original: chos can 'ba' zhig pa 'gog na yang gnod par 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di gsal par byed do //
analyzed: chos can 'ba' zhig pa 'gog na yang gnod par 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di gsal par byed do //
translated: It also makes clear that it is not the case that it is undermined if one refutes the mere subject.

original: gal te de la zhes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bkag pa'i rgyu mtshan chos gzhan des gal te ma bsal zhing /
analyzed: gal te de la zhes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bkag pa'i rgyu mtshan chos gzhan des gal te ma bsal zhing /
translated: The phrase “if it is not eliminated by that” refers to the property to be proven. The reason is that the other property does not eliminate it.

original: gal te gnod par bya ba de la de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i gnod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la'ang ma yin par 'gyur na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gal te gnod par bya ba de la de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i gnod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la'ang ma yin par 'gyur na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If it were not so, then the object to be harmed would not be the object to be accomplished by the harm that comes from that.

original: sgra mnyan bya ma yin no zhes pa'i mnyan bya'i sgras 'dir /
analyzed: sgra mnyan bya ma yin no zhes pa'i mnyan bya'i sgras 'dir /
translated: The word “audible” in the phrase “sound is not audible” means

original: ngo bo sna tshogs can gyi sgra'i ngo bo gang nyan pa'i shes pa la snang ba /
analyzed: ngo bo sna tshogs can gyi sgra'i ngo bo gang nyan pa'i shes pa la snang ba /
translated: that the nature of sound, which has various natures, appears to the consciousness that hears it.

original: sna @140b tshogs su snang ba'i blo mthong ba med pa'i phyir na rigs la sogs pa'i 'brel ba can gzhan gyis dben pa de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: sna @140b tshogs su snang ba'i blo mthong ba med pa'i phyir na rigs la sogs pa'i 'brel ba can gzhan gyis dben pa de kho na bshad do //
translated: Because there is no seeing of the mind that appears as various, it is said that it is devoid of other things, such as universals, and that is reality.

original: nyan pa'i shes pas gzung bar bya'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: nyan pa'i shes pas gzung bar bya'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: It is because it is to be apprehended by the consciousness that hears it.

original: de kho na bstan pa'i don du mdor mngon sum don dang zhes don bshad do //
analyzed: de kho na bstan pa'i don du mdor mngon sum don dang zhes don bshad do //
translated: In order to teach that reality, it is said in brief, “The object of perception,” and the object is explained.

original: nyan pa'i dbang po'i yul 'di kho na spong na mngon sum gyis gnod kyi /
analyzed: nyan pa'i dbang po'i yul 'di kho na spong na mngon sum gyis gnod kyi /
translated: If this very object of the hearing faculty is rejected, then it is contradicted by perception,

original: spyi la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not a universal.

original: gang phyir 'di ltar gyur pa'i ngo bo de kho na don te /
analyzed: gang phyir 'di ltar gyur pa'i ngo bo de kho na don te /
translated: Because in that case, that very nature is the object.

original: lhag ma shes bya nyid la sogs pa spyi ni dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma shes bya nyid la sogs pa spyi ni dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: The remaining universals, such as knowability, are not the nature of entities.

original: dngos po ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin la /
translated: Because they are not entities, they are not objects of the senses.

original: de'i phyir de spong na gnod pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di mnyan bya brjod pas gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de spong na gnod pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di mnyan bya brjod pas gsal bar byas so //
translated: Therefore, when they are refuted, there is no harm. This is made clear by the statement that they are not to be heard.

original: gal te dbang po'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi don mngon par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi don mngon par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If the nature of the object of the senses is what is desired,

original: de rang gi ming gis brjod par bya //
analyzed: de rang gi ming gis brjod par bya //
translated: then it should be expressed by its own name.

original: cis min zhe na /
analyzed: cis min zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa kun du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa kun du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because its intrinsic identity is never to be expressed.

original: spyi'i ngo bos rjod par byed pa la /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bos rjod par byed pa la /
translated: When it is expressed by a universal nature,

original: mnyan par bya ba'i sgras sam gzhan gyis brjod par bya'o zhes khyad par ci'ang med do zhes bas 'di la mngon par zhe na bya ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba'i sgras sam gzhan gyis brjod par bya'o zhes khyad par ci'ang med do zhes bas 'di la mngon par zhe na bya ma yin no //
translated: there is no difference at all whether it is expressed by the word “to be heard” or by another word. Therefore, there is no reason to be attached to this.

original: gzhan yang nyan pa'i shes pa las don de 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan pa'i shes pa las don de 'grub ste /
translated: Moreover, that object is established by the hearing consciousness.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other means of establishing it.

original: de'i phyir de'i stobs las rang bzhin grub pa ni de kho nas tha snyad du bya'o zhes pa 'di ni de ltar mngon par brjod pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i stobs las rang bzhin grub pa ni de kho nas tha snyad du bya'o zhes pa 'di ni de ltar mngon par brjod pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the nature of a thing by that very means is to be conventionally expressed. This is the purpose of the statement.

original: gzhan yang sgra la de ltar bu'i ngo bo de med do zhes smra pa bo'i nyan pa'i shes pa'i mngon sum kho nas gnod pa'o zhes pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dis kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra la de ltar bu'i ngo bo de med do zhes smra pa bo'i nyan pa'i shes pa'i mngon sum kho nas gnod pa'o zhes pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dis kyang /
translated: Moreover, the statement “The nature of sound is not like that” is contradicted by the direct perception of the hearer.

original: sgra ni dbang po'i spyod yul gyi rang bzhin du mnyan bya'i sgras bshad do //
analyzed: sgra ni dbang po'i spyod yul gyi rang bzhin du mnyan bya'i sgras bshad do //
translated: Sound is explained as the nature of the domain of the sense faculty.

original: rjes su dpag par dang 'gal ba'i dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par dang 'gal ba'i dper brjod pa ni /
translated: An example of contradiction with inference is:

original: bum pa rtag go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa rtag go zhes pa'o //
translated: “The pot is permanent.”

original: bum pa la brdegs par bzod pa /
analyzed: bum pa la brdegs par bzod pa /
translated: The pot is not able to withstand being struck.

original: mthong ba las 'ga' zhig gis 'khrul pas 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba las 'ga' zhig gis 'khrul pas 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is seen by some, but it is mistaken.

original: de yang mthong ba 'gags pa'i bum pa bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i phyir mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba 'gags pa'i bum pa bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i phyir mi srid do //
translated: Moreover, it is impossible for the pot to arise, etc., as if the seeing were ceased.

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i bum pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i bum pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
translated: But if no impermanent pot exists at all,

original: der yang gsal ba mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /🔽de'i gnas skabs nyid ni rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: der yang gsal ba mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na / de'i gnas skabs nyid ni rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: then the manifestation of the pot would not be perceived.🔽We say that the state of the pot is its permanence,

original: de'i gnas skabs nyid ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du smra'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs nyid ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du smra'o //
translated: and the nonstate of the pot is its impermanence.

original: de ni 'gags pa la yod do zhes pas /🔽zhig pa'i phyir ram mi snang pa'i phyir @141a * //
analyzed: de ni 'gags pa la yod do zhes pas / zhig pa'i phyir ram mi snang pa'i phyir @141a * //
translated: It exists in the state of cessation.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir mngon par zhen bya ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir mngon par zhen bya ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to insist that the pot is destroyed or that it is not perceived.

original: tshad ma rnam pa mad do zhes pa ni yid ches bas gnod pa'i dper brjod do //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam pa mad do zhes pa ni yid ches bas gnod pa'i dper brjod do //
translated: The example of the contradiction of a valid cognition is an example of contradiction by testimony.

original: 'o na tshad mas gnod par 'gyur la /🔽de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'o na tshad mas gnod par 'gyur la / de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: But if it is contradicted by a valid cognition,🔽then there are two kinds of valid cognitions:

original: des na des byas pa'i gnod pa de ma thag par brjod pa rnam pa gnyis kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na des byas pa'i gnod pa de ma thag par brjod pa rnam pa gnyis kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction that it produces is of two kinds.

original: gang 'di yid ches pas gnod pa dang grags pas gnod pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'di yid ches pas gnod pa dang grags pas gnod pa ste /
translated: The contradiction by testimony and the contradiction by what is commonly recognized.

original: gnod pa gnyis po 'di dag ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa gnyis po 'di dag ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How are these two kinds of contradiction?

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa gsum du dbye ba byas nas gnod pa de rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa gsum du dbye ba byas nas gnod pa de rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
translated: The fourfold division of the refutation is made by dividing inference into three types.

original: mngon sum gyis gcig dang rjes su dpag pas rnam pa gsum mo zhes bsdus nas rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gcig dang rjes su dpag pas rnam pa gsum mo zhes bsdus nas rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The fourfold division is made by combining the one type of direct perception with the three types of inference.🔽How are the three types of inference included in the previously mentioned three types of evidence?🔽We reply:🔽The first type of inference is called “inferential evidence based on what is commonly acknowledged by others.” The second type is called “inferential evidence based on what is commonly acknowledged by the world.” The third type is called “inferential evidence based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.”🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.

original: yang gang gi rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba rnam gsum du 'gyur ba ji skad bshad pa'i rtags kyi nang du khas blangs pa la sogs pa ci ltar 'dus par 'gyur zhe na /🔽brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang gang gi rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba rnam gsum du 'gyur ba ji skad bshad pa'i rtags kyi nang du khas blangs pa la sogs pa ci ltar 'dus par 'gyur zhe na / brjod par bya ste /
translated: The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.🔽The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.

original: de la khas blangs pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags dang / grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de la khas blangs pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags dang / grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.🔽The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.🔽The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.🔽The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.🔽The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.🔽The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.

original: bdag gam gzhan don ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas ngag 'jug pa ni yid ches bar mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: bdag gam gzhan don ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas ngag 'jug pa ni yid ches bar mngon par 'dod do //
translated: The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect. The second type is based on the evidence of nature.

original: de ltar ni bstan bcos khas len pa'i rgol ba des de'i byed pa po dang bdag nyid kyang rnam pa 'di lta bur khas blangs la /
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan bcos khas len pa'i rgol ba des de'i byed pa po dang bdag nyid kyang rnam pa 'di lta bur khas blangs la /
translated: The third type of inference is based on what is commonly acknowledged by the opponent.🔽The first type of inference is based on the evidence of effect.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yid ches pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yid ches pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba dag ste /
translated: Therefore, these are called “trustworthy words.”

original: 'di dag gi don de lta bur gyur pa med bar ngag 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi don de lta bur gyur pa med bar ngag 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of these words is not that the words are used without the corresponding object.

original: de ni smra ba po'i bsam pa'i ngor byed pas 'bras bur rnam pa gzhag la /
analyzed: de ni smra ba po'i bsam pa'i ngor byed pas 'bras bur rnam pa gzhag la /
translated: Since this is based on the speaker’s intention, it is posited as a result.

original: rang gi 'bras bus yang dag par bstan pa des ni rang las phyin ci log tu khas blangs pa'i gegs byed do //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bus yang dag par bstan pa des ni rang las phyin ci log tu khas blangs pa'i gegs byed do //
translated: Since it is indicated by its own result, it prevents the opponent from accepting the opposite of that.

original: gags tsam gyi mtshan nyid can yang 'dir gnod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gags tsam gyi mtshan nyid can yang 'dir gnod par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the mere prevention of that is the characteristic of refutation.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos bsdus nas yid ches pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos bsdus nas yid ches pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Thus, because it is similar to a result-based argument, it is called “trustworthy words” by collecting one’s own words and treatises.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du khas len na rgol ba'i tshig pha rol po nges su gzhug pa'i ched du 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan bcos tshad ma nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du khas len na rgol ba'i tshig pha rol po nges su gzhug pa'i ched du 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan bcos tshad ma nyid ma yin na /
translated: Just as one’s own words are not accepted as valid cognition, and one does not engage in debate for the purpose of convincing the opponent, in the same way, if the treatise is not valid cognition,

original: des rab tu grub pa'i chos can tshad ma med pa can rnam par dpyod pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di ni gnyis ka yid ches pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du @141b mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yin no //🔽sbyar bas ston pa la yang 'di kho na mtshungs pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: des rab tu grub pa'i chos can tshad ma med pa can rnam par dpyod pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di ni gnyis ka yid ches pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du @141b mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yin no // sbyar bas ston pa la yang 'di kho na mtshungs pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan no //
translated: This is another reason why the statement of the opponent is similar to the statement of the Buddhist in that both are equally beyond the pale of rational analysis.🔽And this is also the reason why the statement of the Buddhist is similar to the statement of the teacher [Kapila] in that both are equally beyond the pale of rational analysis.

original: gang gis 'di ltar 'di dag mtshungs pa yin pa des dpe brjod pa'ang 'dir 'dra bar slob dpon gyis gzhal bya'i don sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar 'di dag mtshungs pa yin pa des dpe brjod pa'ang 'dir 'dra bar slob dpon gyis gzhal bya'i don sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams med do zhes bstan to //
translated: The master [Nagarjuna] has shown that the reason why the two statements are similar is that they are both equally devoid of valid cognitions that establish the objects of their assertions.

original: yang dngos por na tshad ma ma yin pa 'di dag gis gegs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi gnod pa ci ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang dngos por na tshad ma ma yin pa 'di dag gis gegs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi gnod pa ci ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: But how can these nonvalid cognitions, which are not valid cognitions in regard to their objects, be said to be obstructive and invalidating?

original: dam bca' ba tsam gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: The answer is that they are so called because they are mere assertions.

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa 'dis na bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'i dam bca' la gnod par byed pa yin gyi dngos por na tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa 'dis na bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'i dam bca' la gnod par byed pa yin gyi dngos por na tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: This teaching of the reason shows that the treatises and one's own words are undermined by a thesis that is not valid, but not by a nonvalid cognition of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag gi yul gyi dbye ba 'di bstan pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa las tha dad par bshad do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag gi yul gyi dbye ba 'di bstan pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa las tha dad par bshad do zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach this division of their objects, it is explained as being different from inference.

original: tsam smos ba ni rang gi tshig la sogs pa la gal te yang rjes su dpag pas gnod par byed pa'ang srid mod /🔽de lta na'ang de la ltos pa med par rgol bas tshad ma nyid du dam bca' tsam gyis dang / rang gi tshig la sogs pa 'gal ba bsam par bya'i /
analyzed: tsam smos ba ni rang gi tshig la sogs pa la gal te yang rjes su dpag pas gnod par byed pa'ang srid mod / de lta na'ang de la ltos pa med par rgol bas tshad ma nyid du dam bca' tsam gyis dang / rang gi tshig la sogs pa 'gal ba bsam par bya'i /
translated: The word mere is used because, although it is possible that one's own words and so on are undermined by inference,

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: nevertheless, without relying on that, one should consider the contradiction of one's own words and so on by the mere thesis that they are valid cognitions, but not by the fact that they are undermined by inference.🔽This is the point that is made clear.

original: 'di yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la ni dper rjod pa gsal po yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la ni dper rjod pa gsal po yin no //
translated: This is a clear example of a contradiction with one’s own words.

original: de ltar ni gal te rgol bas rang gi tshig tshad ma nyid du khas mi len na de'i tshe pha rol pos rtogs par bya ba'i ched du tshig cung zad kyang mi brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni gal te rgol bas rang gi tshig tshad ma nyid du khas mi len na de'i tshe pha rol pos rtogs par bya ba'i ched du tshig cung zad kyang mi brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the opponent does not accept that his own words are valid cognition, then he would not utter even a single word in order to make the other party understand.

original: rjod par yang byed do //
analyzed: rjod par yang byed do //
translated: But he does utter words.

original: de'i phyir tshig pha rol po'i rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por rjod par byed pas tshad ma nyid du khas blangs la de'i phyir de tshad mar yod pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'i rjod pas ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig pha rol po'i rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por rjod par byed pas tshad ma nyid du khas blangs la de'i phyir de tshad mar yod pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'i rjod pas ni /
translated: Therefore, since he utters words that are the means of establishing the other party’s understanding, he accepts that they are valid cognition. Therefore, the words that make the other party understand that they are valid cognition

original: tshad ma med pa'i dam bca' sel bar byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i dam bca' sel bar byed do //
translated: eliminate the thesis that there is no valid cognition.

original: lung dang 'gal ba la ni bshad pa 'di phyogs tsam ston pa yin te /
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba la ni bshad pa 'di phyogs tsam ston pa yin te /
translated: As for the contradiction with scripture, this explanation is just a brief indication.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos la brten pa'i stobs kho nas tshad ma nyid du gdon mi za bar rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos la brten pa'i stobs kho nas tshad ma nyid du gdon mi za bar rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For it is not that valid cognition is ascertained only by the power of the treatise.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: shes pa 'ga' zhig la don shes nas /
analyzed: shes pa 'ga' zhig la don shes nas /
translated: Some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are known.

original: don bya ba la mi slu bar nyams su myong ba las kyang ste /
analyzed: don bya ba la mi slu bar nyams su myong ba las kyang ste /
translated: And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are experienced.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are inferred.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are remembered.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are recognized.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not experienced.

original: rnam pa de lta bu rnams ni nyams su ma myong ba de yongs su mthong ba'i don can bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa rnams kyang de'i rang bzhin nyid @142a * //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu rnams ni nyams su ma myong ba de yongs su mthong ba'i don can bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa rnams kyang de'i rang bzhin nyid @142a * //
translated: And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not seen.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not heard.

original: de zhes tshad ma nyid du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de zhes tshad ma nyid du rtogs par byed do //
translated: And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not known.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not experienced.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not inferred.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not remembered.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not recognized.

original: de la gang gi tshe khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos kyi rab tu grub pa'i tshad ma rnams spong bar byed pa de'i tshe 'di bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i dpe brjod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos kyi rab tu grub pa'i tshad ma rnams spong bar byed pa de'i tshe 'di bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i dpe brjod du 'gyur ro //
translated: And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not experienced.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not seen.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not heard.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not known.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not experienced.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not inferred.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not remembered.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not recognized.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not not experienced.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not not seen.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not not heard.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not not known.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not not experienced.🔽And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects that are not not not inferred.

original: gang gi tshe bstan bcos lam brten par tshad ma yod pa nyid du khong du chud pa de'i tshe 'di lung dang 'gal ba'i dper rjod du 'thad pa ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir khas blangs pa gnod pa la 'di phyogs tsam bstan par bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bstan bcos lam brten par tshad ma yod pa nyid du khong du chud pa de'i tshe 'di lung dang 'gal ba'i dper rjod du 'thad pa ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir khas blangs pa gnod pa la 'di phyogs tsam bstan par bshad do //
translated: And some cognitions are nondeceptive with regard to objects

original: 'di la dper brjod pa gsal ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la dper brjod pa gsal ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The following is an example of this:

original: chos ni tshe 'phos nas bde ba ster ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni tshe 'phos nas bde ba ster ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma does not bestow happiness after death.

original: de ltar ni chos ni bstan bcos kyi gzhag pa'i chos can yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni chos ni bstan bcos kyi gzhag pa'i chos can yin zhing /
translated: In this case, the Dharma is the subject posited by the treatise.

original: de la bde ba mi ster ba nyid bsgrub bar bya ba la /
analyzed: de la bde ba mi ster ba nyid bsgrub bar bya ba la /
translated: And the thesis is that it does not bestow happiness.

original: bde ba ster ba nyid du bstan bcos su mthong bas gnod pa'o //🔽gal te lung dang rang gi tshig dag gis gags tsam byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bde ba ster ba nyid du bstan bcos su mthong bas gnod pa'o // gal te lung dang rang gi tshig dag gis gags tsam byed pa yin na /
translated: This is undermined by the fact that it is seen in the treatise that it does bestow happiness.

original: 'o na da 'di dag gi khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na da 'di dag gi khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: If the contradiction is merely a verbal one, then what is the difference between this and the previous two?

original: ci'ang med do //
analyzed: ci'ang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all.

original: gal te ci'ang med na 'di dag rigs pa'i sgor tha dad du gsungs pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'ang med na 'di dag rigs pa'i sgor tha dad du gsungs pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: If there is no difference, then why are these three stated as separate types of logical reasoning?

original: ngag gi dbye ba las te /🔽rang nyid kho nas pha rol po'i sgo can gyi ngag gzhan gyis don 'ga' zhig so sor bzhag nas /
analyzed: ngag gi dbye ba las te / rang nyid kho nas pha rol po'i sgo can gyi ngag gzhan gyis don 'ga' zhig so sor bzhag nas /
translated: They are different in terms of the verbal expression.🔽In the case of contradiction by scripture, one’s own words are used to establish a certain point for an opponent.

original: yang de kho na phyi mas nyams par byed pa'i phyir lung dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: yang de kho na phyi mas nyams par byed pa'i phyir lung dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: But then that very point is undermined by one’s own later words.

original: dper na 'ug pa pas sgra rtag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ug pa pas sgra rtag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “The sound of an owl is permanent.”

original: gang de nyid kyis rang gi don dang 'gal na rang gi tshig 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: gang de nyid kyis rang gi don dang 'gal na rang gi tshig 'gal ba ste /
translated: If it contradicts its own meaning, it is a contradiction of one’s own words.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin zhes pa dang / smras pa thams cad brdzun yin no zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin zhes pa dang / smras pa thams cad brdzun yin no zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “Inference is not a valid means of knowledge,” and “All speech is false.”

original: gang la'ang zhes pa la sogs pas grags pas gnod pa dper brjod do //
analyzed: gang la'ang zhes pa la sogs pas grags pas gnod pa dper brjod do //
translated: The example of contradiction by what is commonly acknowledged is stated by “Whatever is commonly acknowledged . . .” and so on.

original: 'dir ri bong can zla ba ma yin no zhes pa dam bca'o //
analyzed: 'dir ri bong can zla ba ma yin no zhes pa dam bca'o //
translated: Here, “The rabbit-bearer is not the moon” is the thesis.

original: 'di'i don ni ri bong can zla ba'i brjod par bya ba nyid med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ri bong can zla ba'i brjod par bya ba nyid med do zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is “The rabbit-bearer does not exist as the object of the term ‘moon.’”

original: de yang sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pa dang 'gal ba'i don gyis sel te /
analyzed: de yang sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pa dang 'gal ba'i don gyis sel te /
translated: That is refuted by the meaning that contradicts what is established by testimony.

original: sgra las byung ba ni grags pa zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba ni grags pa zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: “Established by testimony” is an inference called “what is commonly acknowledged.”

original: des rab tu grub cing nges pa ni sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: des rab tu grub cing nges pa ni sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pa'o //
translated: “Established by that” is established by testimony.

original: yang 'di nyid kyi don gzhan 'di shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'di nyid kyi don gzhan 'di shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this meaning should be understood in another way.

original: zla ba zla ba zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa sgra'i rgyu can gyi tha snyad ni sgra las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: zla ba zla ba zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa sgra'i rgyu can gyi tha snyad ni sgra las byung ba yin la /
translated: The convention month after month and so forth, which is based on sound, is derived from sound.

original: de las rab tu grub cing skyes pa 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos ni sgra las byung ba las rab tu @142b grub pa ste /
analyzed: de las rab tu grub cing skyes pa 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos ni sgra las byung ba las rab tu @142b grub pa ste /
translated: The phenomenon which is established and produced from that, and which has the characteristic of being the object of expression of the sound, is the established from the derived from sound.

original: mchog tu grub pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don la rab kyi sgra nye bar blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu grub pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don la rab kyi sgra nye bar blangs pa yin no //
translated: The word parama, supreme, is used in the sense of making known the supreme establishment.

original: mchog tu ni de don thams cad la grub ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu ni de don thams cad la grub ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is supreme because it is established in all objects.

original: des 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang sgra'i tha snyad las skyes pa'i chos grags ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas nges pa ji skad bshad pa'i ngo bo can yin zhing des gnod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang sgra'i tha snyad las skyes pa'i chos grags ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas nges pa ji skad bshad pa'i ngo bo can yin zhing des gnod do zhes pa'o //
translated: The phenomenon which is produced from the convention of sound, which is called the inference called prasiddha, is ascertained to have the nature explained above, and it is that which refutes.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because it is not shared, and so forth.

original: yod pa nyid la sogs pa gnod bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid la sogs pa gnod bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The reason that refutes existence, etc. is unique.

original: de'i phyir yang rjes su dpag pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rjes su dpag pa med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no inference.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra'i rung ba nyid spongs pa la yang gang la dngos po thams cad la 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yod pa nyid kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa der rtags gzhan rjes su 'gro bar gal 'gyur zhes pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra'i rung ba nyid spongs pa la yang gang la dngos po thams cad la 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yod pa nyid kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa der rtags gzhan rjes su 'gro bar gal 'gyur zhes pas /
translated: Even when one abandons the acceptability of the word “existence,” etc., that which is the mode of occurrence of all entities is also non-pervading. How could another reason be pervading there?

original: 'dir gtan tshigs rnam pa thams cad thun mong ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa 'di rtogs pa ni gtan tshigs la yod pa nyid dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs rnam pa thams cad thun mong ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa 'di rtogs pa ni gtan tshigs la yod pa nyid dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Thus, the statement “Here, the reason is unique in all aspects” is the result of the illustration of the existence of the reason.

original: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa mthun phyogs zla ba ma yin pa la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa mthun phyogs zla ba ma yin pa la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ste /
translated: Now, in the case of a pot, etc., existence is not in the similar class, but in the dissimilar class.

original: des na 'di ci ltar thun mong ma yin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di ci ltar thun mong ma yin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How then is this unique?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod du rung ba nyid ni don thams cad la 'byung ba can yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod du rung ba nyid ni don thams cad la 'byung ba can yin no //
translated: The capacity of the word is present in all things.🔽For, the capacity of all words, whether they have been conventionally

original: de ltar ni brda byas pa rnams dang brda ma byas pa'i sgra rnams kyi rung ba ni thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni brda byas pa rnams dang brda ma byas pa'i sgra rnams kyi rung ba ni thams cad yin no //
translated: established or not, is universal.

original: 'dod ba tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod ba tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they function merely through desire.🔽The capacity of all words is related to the capacity of the word, by the

original: sgra'i rung ba nyid kyi stobs kho na las sgra thams cad sgra'i rung ba nyid la 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i rung ba nyid kyi stobs kho na las sgra thams cad sgra'i rung ba nyid la 'brel pa ste /
translated: force of the capacity of the word alone.🔽Whenever one desires to apply a word to a certain thing, then at that

original: gang gi tshe kho na sgra gang zhig don gang la sbyor bar 'dod pa de'i tshe kho na de de la sbyor bar nus so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho na sgra gang zhig don gang la sbyor bar 'dod pa de'i tshe kho na de de la sbyor bar nus so zhes pa'o //
translated: time one is able to apply it to it.🔽The capacity of the word “pot” to denote a pot is established by the mere

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams la'ang 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid rab tu grub pa kho na'o zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams la'ang 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid rab tu grub pa kho na'o zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: desire to express the pot.

original: rung ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because of the capacity.

original: dper na 'tshed par byed bzhin pa ma yin yang 'tshed pa po nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'tshed par byed bzhin pa ma yin yang 'tshed pa po nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though one is not cooking, one can still be a cooker.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang zla ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang zla ba ste /
translated: Therefore, even such things as pots are the moon.

original: dper na zla ba ma yin pa 'ga' zhig la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: dper na zla ba ma yin pa 'ga' zhig la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: For example, existence does not pervade something that is not the moon.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not shared.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: This is true, but

original: 'di mi mthun phyogs kho na la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di mi mthun phyogs kho na la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: since it exists only in the discordant class,

original: 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: it is contradictory,

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid du ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid du ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: but it is not not shared.

original: 'di ni bden te /🔽pha rol pos bum ba la @143a * //🔽sogs pa rnams mi mthun phyogs nyid du mi 'dod do zhes pa 'di'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te / pha rol pos bum ba la @143a * // sogs pa rnams mi mthun phyogs nyid du mi 'dod do zhes pa 'di'i phyir /
translated: This is true,🔽but the opponent does not assert that such things as pots are discordant classes.

original: pha rol po'i bsam pas mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po'i bsam pas mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the discordant class is engaged on the basis of the opponent’s thoughts.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa 'ga' zhig go //
translated: It is said to be not shared.

original: yang na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa la zhes pa 'di'i don gzhan 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa la zhes pa 'di'i don gzhan 'di yin te /
translated: Or, the meaning of this statement “because it is not shared” is different.

original: gang grags pa la log par zhugs pa thams cad la grags pa nyid mi 'dod pa ri bong can zla ba ma yin zhes /
analyzed: gang grags pa la log par zhugs pa thams cad la grags pa nyid mi 'dod pa ri bong can zla ba ma yin zhes /
translated: In all cases of engaging in what is renowned, if one does not accept what is renowned, one is like the one who says, “The rabbit-bearer is not the moon.”

original: yongs su bshad pa can gyi don med pa nyid du so sor shes pa'am dam bcas pa la /
analyzed: yongs su bshad pa can gyi don med pa nyid du so sor shes pa'am dam bcas pa la /
translated: In the case of the meaning of the explanation, one should understand or assert that it is meaningless.

original: de'i ngor rjes su dpag pa med par gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i ngor rjes su dpag pa med par gsungs te /
translated: It is said that there is no inference for that person.

original: 'jig rten gyi yongs su bshad pa can gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yongs su bshad pa can gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i'o //
translated: It is the proof of the meaning of the explanation of the world.

original: de ni ri bong can ji srid pa'ang zla bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: de ni ri bong can ji srid pa'ang zla bar mi 'dod na /
translated: As long as the rabbit-bearer is not accepted as the moon,🔽what is accepted as the established common ground of what could be an example?

original: gang gi dper 'gyur ba grags bas grub pa ci zhig 'dod par 'gyur zhes pas rab tu 'jug pa po'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi dper 'gyur ba grags bas grub pa ci zhig 'dod par 'gyur zhes pas rab tu 'jug pa po'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is the uncommon reason of the one who engages.

original: gal te yang de lta ma yin pa de lta na'ang 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i grags pas grub pa dang 'gal ba'i don gyis ji skad bshad pa'i dam bca'i don la gnod par byed do /
analyzed: gal te yang de lta ma yin pa de lta na'ang 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i grags pas grub pa dang 'gal ba'i don gyis ji skad bshad pa'i dam bca'i don la gnod par byed do /
translated: If it were not so, then even if it were so, the meaning of the thesis explained above would be undermined by the meaning that contradicts the established common ground that engages by mere assertion.

original: 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba dngos po la nges pa med pa'i brda can sgra 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rung ba ni dngos po thams cad yin pas te /🔽'dod pa la 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na 'dod pa tsam gyi dbang du gyur pa'i brda'i rjes su byed pa'i sgra rnams kyi don nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba dngos po la nges pa med pa'i brda can sgra 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rung ba ni dngos po thams cad yin pas te / 'dod pa la 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro // des na 'dod pa tsam gyi dbang du gyur pa'i brda'i rjes su byed pa'i sgra rnams kyi don nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The domain of words that are related to mere desire and that have no fixed connection with things is all things, because there is no stopping desire.

original: 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra'i yul gyi don la 'gog pa 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra'i yul gyi don la 'gog pa 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of words that are related to mere desire is not fixed, it is contradictory to stop the meaning of words that are adventitious.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra 'tshed pa po la sogs pa rang gi rgyu mtshan med pa las don la 'gog pa dang / dper na zla ba nyid ces bya ba don dam par na yod pa ma yin no zhes don dam pa pa'i don 'gog pa de'i tshe grags pas gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra 'tshed pa po la sogs pa rang gi rgyu mtshan med pa las don la 'gog pa dang / dper na zla ba nyid ces bya ba don dam par na yod pa ma yin no zhes don dam pa pa'i don 'gog pa de'i tshe grags pas gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: When words that have a reason, such as “cooker,” are stopped in regard to their referent, which lacks its own reason for existence, and when the meaning of an ultimate is stopped, as in “the moon itself does not ultimately exist,” then there is no fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged.

original: gang gi phyir yongs su bshad pa kho na'i don 'gog pa byed bzhin ba la grags pas gnod par 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni ma yin ba de'i phyir yul gyi khyad par 'di kho na bstan pa'i ched du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su bshad pa kho na'i don 'gog pa byed bzhin ba la grags pas gnod par 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni ma yin ba de'i phyir yul gyi khyad par 'di kho na bstan pa'i ched du /
translated: Because it is only the meaning of the explanation that is refuted, and it is refuted by what is renowned, not by anything else, therefore, this very distinction of objects is taught.

original: grags pa dang rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin yang tha dad du byas te /
analyzed: grags pa dang rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin yang tha dad du byas te /
translated: Although it is not external to what is renowned and inference, it is distinguished.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: rjes su dpag pa la rtags kyi bye brag du ba la sogs pa ji snyed pa de rnams kyis gnod @143b pa'ang so so so sor bshad par bya bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la rtags kyi bye brag du ba la sogs pa ji snyed pa de rnams kyis gnod @143b pa'ang so so so sor bshad par bya bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: For inference, there would be as many different reasons as there are types of smoke, and each of them would have to be explained.

original: tha dad du byas pa don med bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad du byas pa don med bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, making a distinction would be pointless.

original: yul gyi dbye ba 'di kho na grags pa tha dad par 'chad pa'i rgyu mtshan du ston cing /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye ba 'di kho na grags pa tha dad par 'chad pa'i rgyu mtshan du ston cing /
translated: This very distinction of objects is taught as the reason for explaining what is renowned as different.

original: khas blangs pas gnod pa dang 'dra bar grags pas gnod pa'ang rgyu dang bcas par /
analyzed: khas blangs pas gnod pa dang 'dra bar grags pas gnod pa'ang rgyu dang bcas par /
translated: Just as it is undermined by what is accepted, it is also undermined by what is renowned, along with the reason.

original: sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pas zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pas zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning because it is established by sound explains this.

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pa kho nas gnod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i sgra las byung bas rab tu grub pa kho nas gnod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is harmed by being established by sound that arises from mere desire.

original: 'dod pa la mi ltos par dngos po'i stobs kyis rab tu grub pas ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa la mi ltos par dngos po'i stobs kyis rab tu grub pas ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It does not mean that it is established by the power of things without regard to desire.

original: yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa dag la ni rgyu dang bcas par gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa dag la ni rgyu dang bcas par gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not said that it is harmed by direct perception and inference along with their causes,

original: sgra mnyan bya ma yin no sgra rtag go zhes rgyu bstan pa dang bral ba kho nar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra mnyan bya ma yin no sgra rtag go zhes rgyu bstan pa dang bral ba kho nar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated only without teaching a cause, as in Sound is not to be heard, sound is permanent.

original: yul gyi dbye ba bstan pas kyang dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su shin tu byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa can gyi grags pa ni dngos po'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye ba bstan pas kyang dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su shin tu byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa can gyi grags pa ni dngos po'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas /
translated: The teaching of the divisions of the object also makes it clear that what is renowned, which is very different from inference that follows whether a thing exists or not, does not operate by the power of things.

original: grags pa'i dbang las dngos po'i yod pa nyid dang ldog pa dang ldog pa ma yin pa dang gcig nyid dang gcig ma yin pa nyid 'grub pa ma yin zhes rtogs par byed do //🔽bshad pa 'dir ni gal te yang 'dod pa tsam gyi dbang du gyur pa dngos po la nges pa ma yin pa'i brda can gyi sgra las byung ba grags ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni du ba las me rjes su dpag pa bzhin du dngos
analyzed: grags pa'i dbang las dngos po'i yod pa nyid dang ldog pa dang ldog pa ma yin pa dang gcig nyid dang gcig ma yin pa nyid 'grub pa ma yin zhes rtogs par byed do // bshad pa 'dir ni gal te yang 'dod pa tsam gyi dbang du gyur pa dngos po la nges pa ma yin pa'i brda can gyi sgra las byung ba grags ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni du ba las me rjes su dpag pa bzhin du dngos
translated: It is not the case that the existence of things is established by the power of fame, nor is it the case that their being the same or not the same is established by the power of fame.🔽In this explanation, although it is not the case that the inference called “fame” arises by the power of things, like the inference of fire from smoke, because it arises from words that are not definite in meaning, which are dependent on mere desire, still, there is no reason to disagree with it. This is the reason that is stated.🔽The syllogism of that inference called “fame” is:

original: po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa ma yin pa de lta na'ang de dang mi mthun pa'i gtan tshigs med do zhes pa 'di yod pa'i gtan tshigs nye bar bkod pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa ma yin pa de lta na'ang de dang mi mthun pa'i gtan tshigs med do zhes pa 'di yod pa'i gtan tshigs nye bar bkod pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: “The subject, a thing, is not established by the power of fame, because it exists only by the power of mere desire, like, for example, the thought of a rabbit’s horns.”

original: grags ba'i ming can gyi rjes su dpag pa de'i sbyor ba ni /🔽gang 'dod ba tsam gyi rjes su byed pa de thams cad du srid de /
analyzed: grags ba'i ming can gyi rjes su dpag pa de'i sbyor ba ni / gang 'dod ba tsam gyi rjes su byed pa de thams cad du srid de /
translated: The syllogism of that inference called “fame” is:

original: yid kyi rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig pa bzhin /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig pa bzhin /
translated: “The subject, a thing, is not established by the power of fame, because it exists only by the power of mere desire, like, for example, the thought of a rabbit’s horns.”

original: don rnams la 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid kyang 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don rnams la 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid kyang 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the object is that it is the expression of the word that is desired, and it is merely the object of desire.

original: 'o na grags pa zhes pa ni tha snyad la brjod la /
analyzed: 'o na grags pa zhes pa ni tha snyad la brjod la /
translated: Now, “fame” is said to be conventional.

original: des na ci ltar 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa nyid grags pa zhes bya bar 'thob ce na nye bar btags pa las te /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa nyid grags pa zhes bya bar 'thob ce na nye bar btags pa las te /
translated: So how is it that “merely the object of desire” is obtained as “fame”? It is through designation.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid gang du chos can nyid du nye bar blangs pa de ni grags pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid gang du chos can nyid du nye bar blangs pa de ni grags pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The expression of the word that is desired is taken as the subject, and that is the result of fame.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir @144a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir @144a * //
translated: Because it is its nature.

original: ro // de'i chos 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed ba nyid kyang grags pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // de'i chos 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed ba nyid kyang grags pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The property of that is merely the object of desire, and it is also the result of fame.🔽Therefore, the expression “fame” occurs through the designation of the result as the cause.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags pa las grags par tha snyad 'byung zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags pa las grags par tha snyad 'byung zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: re zhig gang grags pas grub pas rang gi chos can las de nyid la dam bca'i don 'gal ba la gnod do zhes pa 'di ni rigs mong /
analyzed: re zhig gang grags pas grub pas rang gi chos can las de nyid la dam bca'i don 'gal ba la gnod do zhes pa 'di ni rigs mong /
translated: The meaning of the thesis is contradictory to the subject.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang khas blangs rnams ni 'jal ba po la 'jug gi gnod par bya ba'i chos can la ni ma yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang khas blangs rnams ni 'jal ba po la 'jug gi gnod par bya ba'i chos can la ni ma yin na /
translated: Direct perception, inference, and assertion are engaged by the one who comprehends, not by the subject that is to be invalidated.

original: de ci ltar de rnams la gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar de rnams la gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they invalidate that?

original: bden te / 'dir mngon sum la sogs pa ni gnod par byed ba po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te / 'dir mngon sum la sogs pa ni gnod par byed ba po ma yin gyi /
translated: It is true that here direct perception and so on are not the invalidator.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de yongs su bcad pa mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams yin la /
analyzed: de yongs su bcad pa mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams yin la /
translated: The phenomena such as the object of hearing that are delimited by them are the invalidator.

original: de rnams 'dir mngon sum la sogs pas gzhal bar byas pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum la sogs pa'i sgra sgro btags pas mtshon par byas so zhes pas kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: de rnams 'dir mngon sum la sogs pas gzhal bar byas pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum la sogs pa'i sgra sgro btags pas mtshon par byas so zhes pas kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: Since they are comprehended by direct perception and so on, there is no fault in their being indicated by the term direct perception and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning of “this” and so on.

original: 'dir chos dang chos can tshogs pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chos dang chos can tshogs pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, only the collection of the predicate and the subject is the probandum.

original: des na thams cad du tshogs pa bsal ba kho na las nye bar 'gog cing /🔽de res 'ga' chos kyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: des na thams cad du tshogs pa bsal ba kho na las nye bar 'gog cing / de res 'ga' chos kyi sgo nas sam /
translated: Therefore, in all cases, the collection is refuted by the mere exclusion of the predicate.🔽Sometimes, that is done by way of the predicate,

original: chos can gyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: chos can gyi sgo nas sam /
translated: sometimes by way of the subject,

original: de gnyis ka'i sgo nas sam /🔽de'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bya ba'o zhes pas des tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i sgo nas sam / de'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bya ba'o zhes pas des tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: sometimes by way of both of those,🔽and sometimes by way of a distinction of those.

original: 'di ni ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ste /
translated: This is the way to make conventional expressions.

original: dper rjod pa bzhi po ni /
analyzed: dper rjod pa bzhi po ni /
translated: The four examples

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal bas te /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal bas te /
translated: are by way of the exclusion of the essence of the predicate.

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gcig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gcig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate one type by way of the exclusion of the essence of the predicate,

original: phyogs tsam bshad pa'o //🔽phyogs 'dis ni chos dang chos can gyi khyad par te skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba rnams dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: phyogs tsam bshad pa'o // phyogs 'dis ni chos dang chos can gyi khyad par te skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba rnams dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba'i sgo nas /
translated: I have explained just a portion.

original: rnam pa gzhan rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: By this method, the other types should be understood by way of the exclusion of the distinction of the predicate and the subject and the exclusion of the essence of the subject.

original: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams las gzhan yin zhes dam bca' ba byas ba la /
analyzed: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams las gzhan yin zhes dam bca' ba byas ba la /
translated: The thesis is: the whole is different from the parts.

original: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The refutation is: the whole is not different from the parts,

original: srang dma' ba'i khyad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa 'di sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: srang dma' ba'i khyad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa 'di sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: because it does not possess the attribute of being lower on the scale.

original: 'dis kyang gzhan khyad par bsal gyi /
analyzed: 'dis kyang gzhan khyad par bsal gyi /
translated: This also refutes the difference,

original: gzhan tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: but not mere difference.

original: de ltar ni pha rol po'ang rdul phra rab rnams la mthong ba dang sgrib pa dang thogs pa la sogs ba'i 'bras bu srid pa ma yin zhes /
analyzed: de ltar ni pha rol po'ang rdul phra rab rnams la mthong ba dang sgrib pa dang thogs pa la sogs ba'i 'bras bu srid pa ma yin zhes /
translated: In this way, the opponent also asserts that it is not possible for the subtle particles to have effects such as seeing, obscuration, obstruction, and so on.

original: de rnams 'grub pa'i ched du yan @144b lag rnams las gzhan pa'i don yan lag can gyi sgra byas pa /
analyzed: de rnams 'grub pa'i ched du yan @144b lag rnams las gzhan pa'i don yan lag can gyi sgra byas pa /
translated: For the sake of establishing those, the term whole is applied to the parts,

original: bya ba dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu ni rdzas so zhes pa rdzas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan pa mthong bya'i rang bzhin can bsgrub par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu ni rdzas so zhes pa rdzas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan pa mthong bya'i rang bzhin can bsgrub par 'dod kyi /
translated: and the definition of substance is that it is the cause of the combination of action, quality, and motion.

original: khyad par ba min pa'i gzhan nyid tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ba min pa'i gzhan nyid tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not mere difference that is not a specific property.

original: de'i phyir de sel ba'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de sel ba'ang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is eliminated.

original: de sel na ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo kho na sel bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de sel na ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo kho na sel bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were eliminated, then the intrinsic reality of the phenomenon would be eliminated,

original: de'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not its specific properties.

original: 'di ni chos kyi khyad par sel bar yang 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi khyad par sel bar yang 'dod do //
translated: This is because it is asserted that the specific properties of a phenomenon are eliminated.

original: des na 'di ni gzhan gyi khyad par sel ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gzhan gyi khyad par sel ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the elimination of the specific properties of other phenomena.

original: ci ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is this done?

original: gal te yan lag can 'di lci ba nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can 'di lci ba nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If this whole is heavy,

original: de ltar yin na 'ji ba la sogs pa'i gong bu dag bsres pa bcal ba dag la /
analyzed: de ltar yin na 'ji ba la sogs pa'i gong bu dag bsres pa bcal ba dag la /
translated: then when a lump of clay and so on is kneaded,

original: rdzas ni rdzas gzhan rtsom zhing yon tan rnams kyang yon tan gzhan no zhes pa'i lugs kyi phyir /
analyzed: rdzas ni rdzas gzhan rtsom zhing yon tan rnams kyang yon tan gzhan no zhes pa'i lugs kyi phyir /
translated: it is a substance that composes another substance and the qualities also compose other qualities.

original: de dag gis yan lag can gyi 'bras bu rdzas gsum pa rtsom pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis yan lag can gyi 'bras bu rdzas gsum pa rtsom pa na /
translated: When they compose a third substance, the resultant whole,

original: de'i yon tan gzhan lci ba zhes bya ba skyes ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yon tan gzhan lci ba zhes bya ba skyes ba'i phyir /
translated: the other quality of heaviness arises.

original: de'i tshe des byas pa srang dma' ba zhes ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe des byas pa srang dma' ba zhes ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the difference called “the low point of the scale” is produced by that.

original: gang du srang dma' ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rdzas gzhan 'du ba can gyi lci ba nyid yod pa de srang dma' ba'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang du srang dma' ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rdzas gzhan 'du ba can gyi lci ba nyid yod pa de srang dma' ba'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: Wherever there is the unhindered ability to produce the difference of the low point of the scale, there is the heaviness that is a different substance from the combination, as in the case of the third lump of clay on the scale.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu gsum pa srang la gzhag pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu gsum pa srang la gzhag pa bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the third lump of clay on the scale.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu gnyis bsres pa dag gzhal ba dag gi yan lag can gyi rdzas gzhan gsum pa rtsom pa la'ang ji skad bshad pa'i lci ba yod do //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu gnyis bsres pa dag gzhal ba dag gi yan lag can gyi rdzas gzhan gsum pa rtsom pa la'ang ji skad bshad pa'i lci ba yod do //
translated: Also, when the two lumps of clay are mixed and weighed, the third substance that is a part of the scale has the heaviness explained above.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the scale.

original: de'i tshe srang dma' ba'i khyad par de'i tshe mtshon pa yang ma yin no zhes pa bzlog pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe srang dma' ba'i khyad par de'i tshe mtshon pa yang ma yin no zhes pa bzlog pas /
translated: At that time, the difference of the low point of the scale is not the indicator.

original: gang na srang dma' ba'i khyad par med pa de na ji skad bshad pa'i lci ba nyid med do //
analyzed: gang na srang dma' ba'i khyad par med pa de na ji skad bshad pa'i lci ba nyid med do //
translated: Wherever there is no difference of the low point of the scale, there is no heaviness explained above.

original: dper na ma bsres par gzhal ba'i 'jim pa'i gong bu dag la bzhin /
analyzed: dper na ma bsres par gzhal ba'i 'jim pa'i gong bu dag la bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the lumps of clay that are weighed without being mixed.

original: bsres nas bcal ba'i 'jim pa'i gong du dag la'ang srang dma' ba'i khyad par med do //
